review: I used to come here quite a bit with family and some friends. It was better then than it is now. The people working in the back are obnoxious and shouting at each other, causing the people who are sitting at the tables near the kitchen to be disrupted and uncomfortable.  (I sat at table 78) I was sitting and listening to one of them shout "SHUT UP" loud enough for a good portion of the restaurant to hear. There were about 5 tables that were not cleaned as I walked in, and it seemed as if it was like that for awhile. Some positives were the fast service and delicious food. The server we had was a friendly and efficient employee; he was one of the two people who asked if I was being helped. I understand it was a high time, but I waited about 15 minutes up front without being asked if I was being helped or needed help. I thought there was supposed to be someone at the front who helps incoming customers and to let them know if there was a table available and/or if there was a wait time.

Stopped here earlier today for lunch! Was craving a burger and I knew Reb Robin would satisfy my hunger!  Started out with both a Very berry raspberry limeade and a Tropical Mai Tai. I always love the limeade so no issues there, the tropical mai tai wasn't bad. But it wasn't great either in my opinion. I just think they could've evened out the ratio of rum to sweetness a little better!  For an appetizer, I got the Jump starter double with jalapeño coins and mozzarella sticks! Delicious! The jalapeño coins are perfectly fried and the mozzarella sticks are nice and crispy, with a melty inside! I also got the pretzels which I have to say were amazing! Soft, not soggy and the cheese sauce was great! It also has a slight kick to it which I love!  Next, I got the Prime chophouse burger medium! When I received the burger, it was more on the well done side but it still was a good burger! Also, the bottomless fries are the best! Those fries are so addicting! The seasoning is also crazy good! Although it's not good for me, I dump it on the fries! No regrets!  Overall, I had a nice lunch today! Parking is a lot with plenty of spaces! Service was quick, staff were very friendly, and I have to say, they are very attentive! At least, in my experience!  Pictures down below!

Was a bit skeptical at first because of some bad reviews here. But totally glad now that we've finally tried it. Our server Eric was helpful and attentive. The burgers were medium rare as requested. The onion rings and dipping sauces were bomb. There was a huge refill of fries for the kids meal. My son ate all 6 pcs of the meatballs. And they even gave him 2 red balloons on our way out (which he loves!). Overall a good experience and we'll be back again for sure. Update: went back recently and sad to say the experience wasn't a good one. Food took a looong time to come out and I think they were short staffed so our server looked unhappy and inattentive. Not planning to come back.

Red Robin, yum! Cmon I know you wanted to start a review of Red Robin like that.  I stopped in for a quick dinner with my cousin. The hostess was very nice and found us a table quickly. I noted very quickly that many servers were sitting at a table chatting. I was a little put off by that because despite the fact that it wasn't super busy I didn't think it was appropriate to be hanging out at a table near people who were dining.  The server came over and took our drink orders while we looked over the menu. We both got happy hour drinks and she disappeared for a good 10-15 minutes. She didn't come back to check if we were ready to order. She eventually came back with the drinks and took our orders. The food came relatively quickly and hot. The burgers were very good and came with bottomless fries. The initial serving of fries that came with the burger was the size of what might come with a kids meal. It seemed like it was overlooked as the plate was put together. We had to flag down the server to get an additional serving.  Once we finished our meal we found out that we could pay through the computerized screen on the table. That was easy enough. I would try Red Robin again because the food was good. Service could use some improvement.

This was my first time here. We had to go to Barnes and Noble but was so hungry and didn't want to go far so we came here.  They sat us by the bar at a high table...I'm not fussy, so whatever. The service was BAD. Everything was fine when we got sat and given menus. But the waitress/bartender asked us if we'd been there before-- we said no...then she explained the menu and offered us beverages. Okay, fine. But why did we get our waters 20 minute later?   Whatever, we forgot about it...now we are ready to order. She took our orders and this is where it just gets bad. We waited about 30+ minutes for our food. He ordered a medium burger and I have the 4 cheese grilled cheese.  We played virtual games on the table kiosk for 30 minutes or so...Our waters were done for a while, too. I'm starting to get antsy and upset. I told my BF to go to The bookstore before they close because he could have gone there and back and the food still wouldn't have come.  Just to play it safe, he didn't leave. The waitress comes and tells us that our food is on it's way out. We wait an additional 10 minutes. We finally get our food. Low and behold...my food was COLD. It was so cold that the bread had hardened. I tried to eat it because I was just so hungry. The bread was so hard it scraped my pallet. I just ate all the fries. The burger can be compared to a Burger King burger. We just wanted to get the heck out of there. Also, the stuff on the bottomless menu...is a JOKE. As soon as she put the broccoli down, it was gone in 2 seconds because there were only 4 in the bowl.   Like what the ACTUAL f*ck?!  She didn't come back until 20 minutes later when he was done with his sub par burger!  She gave him another 5 broccli!  I was so mad, I pressed the "call a waitress" button on the kiosk. She never came!  I had NO patience and thankfully, I remembered that you can pay through the kiosk. I paid and gave the lowest tip possible...15%. She didn't deserve that tip. I wasn't going to leave anything.  We just got up and left. What's worse...both of us ended up feeling sick after that meal. I'm NEVER going back there. I don't know how anyone goes there regularly. Nothing is "yummmmm" about that place. You're better off going to Wendy's.

How hard is it to mess up a burger and some onion rings???? Well it must be pretty hard. Onion rings tasted like the oil they were fried in was old, thus the weird after taste and almost metallic taste. Not enough ketchup or barbecue sauce in the world to cover that taste not alone the possibility of bathroom Olympics later in the evening if you keep eating them. I had the manager take them away. Yucky the opposite of Yummy. Hello No. Hamburger - I don't know, good gosh, seriously, ewww.  Do they have frozen burgers at Red Robin??? Probably. Do you see me rolling my eyes. G said his was tolerable.  Maybe I was just being Pamela Picky Pants or something but the whole thing was just nasty. I gave 2 stars because G ate his and I took the French fries home to the birds. Side note, the French fries were soggy and cold.

Okay, I promise not to reference the catchy jingle of this place even though it's fun to quote. But a restaurant should be much more than a little slogan. It needs to have good grub as well. Red Robin isn't anything close to grand (especially in the wide world of burgers), but last night's dinner was worthy of 3.5 stars (and a round up to four knowing I'll return).  The place used be a little too kitschy and almost childish, but more recently they've given themselves a facelift to portray a bit more of a contemporary adult vibe. There's still plenty of fun decor including burger-themed seats by the front entrance and a mural of colored baseballs creating a replica of the American Flag. They've also tried to put some focus on beer, which, in this growing craft brew world, is a smart move. Though this smart move is a bit more like a nice gesture as their craft beer listings aren't too vast. We'll chalk it up to a work-in-progress. Beyond drink, there's a decent selection of apps to start your meal with. We went for the onion ring tower. Clever in presentation and decent in taste with a few sauces for dipping accompanied on the side. The real reason you're probably coming is for the plethora of burger options RR serves up. I'll give them some serious credit in having a wide array of styles, toppings, and creative limited edition burgers on hand. That being said, the meat quality isn't anything mouthwatering. Their vaguely cooked-to-order (some pink or no pink) which is another nice gesture, though I'd prefer slight more attention to detail in the meat than having so many  topping options. But, when in Red Robin, do as the menu orders and get a burger loaded with goodies. Personal favorite (and choice last night) is the Burnin' Love burger (fried jalapeños, salsa, pepper-jack, lettuce, tomatoes and chipotle aioli on a jalapeño-cornmeal bun). Everything works well together to create some quality heat and fresh flavor.  Overall, Red Robin tries hard to reach a level of burger that other places reach with much more ease. They may not have the greatest beef, but they'll concoct a burger with a wonderful assortment of toppings. I'll return for that aspect and hopefully (with a little work) some beer as well.

Ehhh....i only came to this place because of the commercials. Decided to check them out. The waitress really didnt care, and just took out order and left. We got their bacon cheeseburger. It wasn't anything spectacular. The burger meat itself tastes like a frozen patty. The fries tasted kinda old. I would give this place another shot if the waitress and service were better or even average. Definitely better to go to another fast food spot.

Mmmm No. TL; DR- I'm sure there are better burger places.   Went in 3p on a Saturday, party of four and had a short wait.  The cute  kids' chalk games in the lobby were worthless without the chalk.  Asked for chalk,  it never came.  Here's the biggest problem here- there's no organization when it comes to waitstaff.  Nobody knows who has what table,  and that leads to tables being ignored (took awhile to get a server) and food was taken to the wrong table  (us) and others (i paid attention).   The bright star of the evening was our server,  Jimmy.  Hustling,  cheery young kid who did his job exceptionally well despite the chaos.   The food was disappointing.   Picky Pete got the smoked pepper burger. Bacon was thin and the burger wasn't seasoned.  This came in handy though because Picky Pete, Jr. ate half because her fried cod was not crispy at all and she deemed it inedible.  Decent flavor but the coating was practically steamed.   Teen is a great eater and demolished her bacon cheddar burger, minus the bacon because they forgot it.  My Burnin Love burger was a huge miss.  It was flavorless, overloaded with mealy mushy tomatoes, and it just wasn't good. I had also asked for a side of their pickled  jalapenos but didn't receive them.   The fries all around are mushy, limp and pale.  My garlic herb fries tasted like feet and no fries,  on any plate,  were hot. Despite what looked like cool options,  we skipped on dessert. Ambience is super cute, but with an open kitchen and burger centric menu, the dining area is loud with kids and kitchen noise. Wee one said,  "This reminds me of Chuck E Cheese."  I don't disagree. ..there just aren't any cool games to distract you from the subpar food.

1 phrase... Reeeeed Robin  Yummmm  Seriously this place never let's us down we love coming here for burger nights and always have a friendly waiter or waitress. Love coming here and will come to this location again!

Despite the bad reviews that my boyfriend and I had read prior to arriving, we still decided to give it a try and we are glad that we did. Surprisingly for a Friday night they were not busy at all and we were seated in a booth immediately. A sweet girl named Alana who ended up being our waitress and took our drink order. In the menu the domestic beers are advertised as $4.50 but when we ordered, Alana informed us that they're actually $5.50 which is no biggie but I am giving a 4 star rating because of that because they should update their menu prices. The drinks came out fairly quick and to our surprise they were served in huge glasses. The $5.50 was definitely worth it and no additional beverages were needed due to that. Red Robin's also has a cool kiosk system which for $1.99, we played unlimited games on (Trivia) and were able to make orders off of as well as pay.  There were so many burgers that I wanted to try but unfortunately I could only chose one so I went with the Buzz Mac & Cheese burger from the Tavern Menu and I opted for the signature patty rather than the double patty. For an additional $1.49, I was able to substitute regular fries for sweet potato fries. The burger patty was a decent size with a generous serving of mac & cheese, pepper jack cheese, lettuce and tomato on it. There was a ranch sauce that was on the burger which I could've done without but it was still very tasty. The bun was not soggy at all as I read in other reviews and the patty was  cooked just how I had ordered it. Although there were many things on the burger, you were still able to taste it all and everything meshed well together. My boyfriend ordered the Siracha Tavern burger which it looked like he enjoyed and was very well stacked with condiments, I almost regretted not ordering it. Once we were done eating, Alana came to check on us and then back again with the check. She was very on top of us without being annoying like most places trying to rush the customers out.  I'm happy that we decided to venture out to Long Island to try these burgers and will definitely be returning to try the rest. This location is ideal because it is steps away from all of the shopping centers on Old Country Road and offers parking. What's better than shopping and a good meal?!

Yummm went here for first time and i got avocado and bacon with cheese on a burger and it was delicious wasnt the best burger ever but not too bad! Love the steak fries and we got the onion ring tower and spinach dip that was soo cheesey and delicious.. i wanted to try the mint chocolate chip brownie but next time i will get that! Will return!

I walked in with my uncle because we wanted a place to grab some some quality food, but nothing too fancy.  The hostess was extremely friendly and happy, and sat us in the bar area...this is where things started to go downhill.  The bartender/waitress really didn't have much of a personality...She was really trying to push us out, and seemed like she didn't want to be there....everything was rushed....the food wasn't bad, the service just wasn't acceptable.
My Staff Jamie & I went Out to Dinner at One of my Favorite Restaurant Red Robin for my Pre Birthday  We Loved The Food  & also The Alcohol  Drinks , Our Waiters were Wonderful

We've been coming to this location since it first opened and have always been satisfied with the food and service.  But we had a waiter named Ben for the last two visits and he is THE BEST!!! Very animated, but not annoying and super-friendly and helpful. Even the kids say, "Make sure you and Daddy give him a good tip!"

Very disappointing. Will never bother going back again. Saturday afternoon not too crowded should have been our clue. I ordered iced tea w/lemon they brought me every sweetener but sugar, when I asked the waiter I was told that they ran out if sugar! Stop + Shop is in the same shopping ctr. My husband ordered his cheeseburger well done with bottomless fries. Received a medium cooked burger with 6 fries on his plate. I ordered the Turkey BLT on a croissant with bottomless fries. This is where Stop + Shop comes in play. The "carved turkey breast" was deli turkey with 2 strips of bacon on the most bread like croissant I have ever had. And they charge 12 or 14 dollars for this! The waiter never came back once to check on us and when told my husband's burger was undercooked he said "oh sorry" picked it up + walked away. Don't waste your time or money here.
This was the typical burger joint. Nothing special. The food was just ok. The service was good and they do have a nice happy hour. It's quiet too. Nice to sit back and watch a football game at

The waitresses here were SO nice!! They were attentive and helpful and that really added on to the experience. I ordered the chicken tortilla soup which is delicious however I wish the serving of it was a little bigger for the price, that won't stop me from ordering it though because it's so good! The campfire sauce is to die for I could use it by the gallon it's so delicious the burger and French fries were great as always too I love how you can customize the burger and change up the bun!

Food was great as always. What made today great was our server, Jimmy!!!! Small writing, big personality!!! He made our entire experience that much better. The staff overall is very good.  We shared corn dogs (fat bastards). Followed by pretzel bites- both delish.  I had a bacon cheeseburger, the misses had a cheeseburger- we were both extremely happy, full and wanted to die upon exiting.  Love this place.  #fatbastard

So after a long week,  the family just wanted good burgers and such so we go to Red Robin.  The staff was generally very nice.  But they took too long to bring out some burgers.  Like the sauces option.  Despite the long food wait,  they were super friendly.  Milkshake was yum!
Still outstanding selection of great burgers always friendly professional service nice cold beer great atmosphere.

This was my second time coming here this summer , Friday night at 7 so I understand it would be busy. We were a group of 8 so the wait was about 20 minutes , not too bad .  When we were seated our waiter came over to us in about 5 mins . He took our drink order first and I asked for water with lemon , I was the first one to place my drink order . He brought only 6 drinks and gave us 4 straws , and we're 8 people . Told him he's missing a few glasses , he comes back with 2 more and non of them had lemon.  I asked about 4 times to bring me lemon before he finally remembered , and by then I was pretty much done with my glass of water . He took our orders and we put in for another order of their bottomless fires because that takes forever to come to the table.  He came to the table and asked if we needed any refills on drinks , I said yes so he took my glass away . Came back with the same glass and the old lemon still in the cup . Took 3 times to ask for chocolate milk for my son , and when everyone at my table needed refills on drinks , he took all our glasses and used the same ones !  He returned to the table and started handing out glasses , how do you know who's is who's ?? I was annoyed at that point and asked the manager of that's something they normally do or are they suppose to give new glasses . He apologize and Said he would speak to his staff . I must say I won't be going back for awhile .

I enjoyed the ambiance, bottomless steak fries that accompanied our entrees and the Bud Light.  The flavor of the Chili Chili Cheese Fries was very underwhelming. I had to spruce it up with ketchup even with all the toppings it came with. The pretzel bites tasted like yesterday's batch. Not warm, soft and savory.  The cod and shrimp entree were of low low quality, worst than high school cafeteria fare.  The Doh rings (combo of a croissant and a donut) were passable dipped in chocolate sauce.  The place is known for burgers so if you like burgers give them a chance.  The service was outstanding, very attentive.

have been going to this chain when it was only located on the west coast. years later when this location near me popped up i was super excited. the burgers are delicious and well cooked. they have a ton if sauces to choose from as well, and i am a sucker for sauces. happy hour is a great time - drinks are a few bucks. you cant go wrong. check out the onion ring tower for an app.

An extra Star for our server who was polite and friendly. Otherwise, 2 stars for the food itself... Came out the kitchen lukewarm at best, and the taste lacked anything to bother describing. Eh.  Saturday afternoon and they were out of pumpkin beer. Day ruined.  Blue cheese burger - limp white onions. Gross. Blue cheese melted off where did it go?  Mac n cheese burger- small and tasteless.   Fries-  not worth it Fried pickles- greasy  Will not return.

First time ever going to Red Robin and I'll just say I was not impressed. Our waiter wasn't the most pleasant nor did he check on us. It seemed like he was doing us a favor when we asked for napkins. The food itself complimented the service. Ordered the peppercorn gourmet burger medium, received an overcooked burger with flimsy bacon. The mac and cheese tasted like dried noodles with sliced cheese melted on top (barf). The best part of our meal were the onion rings and the water. I wouldn't come back here even if the food was free.

RED ROBIN....YUMMMM! I can't rave enough about Red Robin's burgers. They are always fresh, hot, huge , juicy & delicious. Love the Smoke & Pepper! Even the appetizer menu - it's great how they have it ranged from mini portions to the actual larger size portion. So you can taste the app yet no get too full on it. From the many times I have been to Red Robin (not just this location) , the food always seems spot on! Delicious! Never leave here Unsatisfied ! Not to mention- BOTTOMLESS FRIES! What what! Good thing the food is great, because the service on the other hand....Whoa! I'm not gonna bad mouth anybody or anything BUT the last time I was there our waitress gave me hope! She was amazing. I'm very very mad at myself for Not getting her name or even remembering it better if I did get her name.  On the table is an tablet for menu items , Playing games while you wait, call your server or even pay you bill. It's a great tool have at Your disposal!  Enjoy your burger!

Honestly I had low expectations. All I knew was the jingle. But we decided to try it and it and it was pretty pretty good. Bottomless fries take a few times and reminders to get, but our server was really nice as was the manger. Bonus the game player was a great way to distract a toddler and pay at!  Will come back!

Nothing like a plate of grease and bad bad bad service. I wish I could give them 0 stars  and get back the past two hours of my life. Time to start hiring a new team that can multi task and doesnt wear their pants below their butt.  Sorry not sorry.

I live for spiked boozy shakes and creative burgers, so Red Robin is dear to my heart. This location renovated and updated their decor so they get star for that alone. You can't beat $7 cocktails and spiked milkshakes, where else can you get this???!! The Quality and price are unmatched.  I love the drink menu. Margaritas galore. Irish Cream, Baileys, Blue Moon Beer shakes. Each creatively put together featuring icecream and booz.  I wish the gourmet burgers offered more toppings and options. So far my favorite have been the Bacon Guacamole & Burning Love. The patties are large and chargrilled. The service is fast and everybody comes for the BOTTOM LESS FRIES. I would recommend getting the Sweet Potato instead of steak cut for an additional $1. They are delicious when hot. This place kind of reminds me of Bobby ' s Burger Palace with the exception of the extensive menu. I love Bobby's.  In the mood for delicious spiked shakes and tasty burgers while in the area? This is your Go to!

Service was mediocre. Didn't ask us for refills. Didn't really check on us. The table they sat us in was the WORST! We sat in a little corner booth by the kitchen and the register. No offense to anyone, but, I really don't want to hear inappropriate personal conversations by the workers while I'm trying to eat. Try to keep your conversations professional especially when you see you have customers dining inches away from you. Was not pleased at all. To top it all off, the food made myself and my boyfriend sick. Not impressed whatsoever. Avoid at all cost if you can. Follow up- went to Dr- it was severe food poisoning. Manager said corporate would be in touch with me yesterday - never happened. It's just a shame. Not impressed. Will be staying away and making sure everyone we know does the same.

You know I keep coming back to this place because I had a really great experience here many years ago but now ever since I've gone back it's just going to complete shit our waiter was not attentive to us at all everybody who seem to work there look like they were high or they didn't want to be there the waiter himself was decently nice but he never checked on us my burger came out dry and I could probably make a Better Burger than they could have any day and on top of it it took like almost an hour  to get our burgers and they messed up the sauce, another issue was that it seemed like the employees were fighting about somethin in the back and I could hear other tables complaining about the service, I'm sorry red robin but your employees are either incredibly lazy or are just high as a kite, the lack of attentiveness I received was incredible I could have left without paying and our waiter would've never even noticed.

I've been to this location a number of times and have always enjoyed my meal. I went again tonight after craving a burger from Red Robin. I usually get something simple, cheeseburger and fries. Sometimes I am adventurous and get sweet potato fries (lol). The burger was cooked exactly as I ordered it, the pickle relish on the burger is delicious !  Our waitress was wonderful tonight! I wish I could remember her name! She was attentive, cheery, and checked up on us multiple times.  We ended up getting a free burger with our rewards card (buy 9 burgers get 1 free!). We didn't even know we were up to that amount until our waitress was sure to have us log into our rewards account.  I'm not sure why there are so many low reviews about the service here but I have never had an issue at this location.

I've been here a few times and I've always been greeted and seated right away. However, this time we waited a minute or two at the empty hostess podium. Then finally a young girl came up to us looking like she was scared or confused?  With that facial expression that was not exactly welcoming, she asked "Can I help you?" And we were like "um table for two?" Not sure if she was new or something but it was a kind of weird, awkward interaction. She  seemed to disappear again and the poor people who came in after us just started seating themselves. One thing I like about Red Robin's burgers is that they don't look like they are basic frozen patties that a lot of restaurants use. I also like my burgers medium rare and I was a little disappointed that it was more like well done. But that's not the end of the world. All the ingredients together tasted  really fresh. I also love that Red Robin has gluten free burger buns! I have always been quite the  burger connoisseur, but it is much harder now having a gluten intolerance. I am grateful for any place that either has a GF Bun option or a lettuce wrap, which Red Robin has both! My boyfriend is diabetic and can't do a lot of carbs so the lettuce wrap is great for him. Our server was super laid back and got our food out pretty fast. The manager as well was extremely courteous and came and checked on us a few times to make sure everything was satisfactory.

Was in the area thought I would give it a go for the first time. It was a Monday early evening and the place was empty.  I decided to sit at the bar which looks quite nice.  Started off with a cold Lite Beer - good start,   Was not really in the mood for a burger so I gave the $10 Nachos a try.  Wait time seemed a bit long, like 15 minutes, considering the place was virtually empty.   Had the distinct feeling that food may be purposely delayed until you have finished your first drink guaranteeing you will order another.   In any event, when the Nachos did arrive they looked a bit sparse.  It appeared as if the chips had been preloaded with a meat mixture and melted cheese and then the other ingredients  placed on the dish once ordered. I assume this since both the meat and cheese were cold and looked dried out from preheating. Two scoops of guacamole & sour cream topped the dish with a few little cups of other ingredients (salsa & hot peppers) that you add yourself.  Once the dish was assembled it was TASTELESS.  Totally bland.  I asked the bartender if she had some hot sauce and she handed me a bottle tabasco sauce from the bar.  Guess I should have opted for the burger but I will never know since I will not be returning anytime soon.   Suggestion: Take your $10, go to Taco Bell, order 2 Nachos Bel Grandes add their "Fire Sauce" and enjoy.
Went here for a meal on Veteran's day. Rude customer service, long wait times, and discrimination against veterans.
Best Burger spot ever!!! I always enjoy the selection of burgers at this place. Service was great this time  (last time they 4got about us and the food was cold). I will be back again!

Food was great but service wasn't.  The waitress never came back to the table. Someone else brought out the food, and she never came back to check if everything was okay.  The only thing that bothered me a little was that there seemed to be little shards of ice in my ranch dressing. It's not a big deal, as ice won't harm me...but it just didn't belong there.

Upon arrival, no greeting what so ever, it was as like, " follow me ass hole, I hate my job!"  On to our waitress, what waitress?!?! She took my order, then disappeared, someone else brought out our drinks, someone else brought out out appetizer, then here comes our waitress, she dropped the order and our table was missing the bottle of ketchup and I asked her for a bottle, instead of her getting the ketchup, she started waiting on others customers, so after awhile, I went to a empty table and grabbed a bottle. On to the food, My oldest son ordered a grilled cheese sandwich with a fruit cup, my little guy wanted a cheese burger and apple slices, I went with the 7.99 burger special ( the website says 6.99) but the waitress advised me that NY doesn't honor the web price, oh well, is what it is,  Now we have our food and my little guy digs into his apple slices and the look in his face was of sheer terror, he tells me it tastes nasty, so I thought my son, being my son was just being a pain in the ass, so I tried it and spat it half way across the restaurant, nasty is a kind word for it, looking for our waitress...again, no where to be seen, so I guess it was the manager came by and I showed him the package of apples, he comped the kids order which was very cool of him, as for my burger, the bun was meh, the lettuce and tomato was soggy, so I ditched that stuff and ate the meat, which was pretty good, the poof, our waitress pops up from her hiding spot, now she's telling me how to order off the kiosk, I look at her and tell her, all I want is a shake and the bill, she insists I order off the kiosk, I'm like WTF! So I place my order, and pay my bill, but instead of paying by CC, I insist on paying cash, just to be a asshole, she brings me my change, and poof, gone again, we'll, I guess she didn't want a tip, so I handed $5.00 to the manager and told him that he did a better job than her. I guess I'll never be a regular here.

My wife and I wanted chicken sandwiches and were right next to red robin. We got an order of pretzel bites and two crispy chicken sandwiches with fries. We ate the pretzel bites on the way home and they were weird. Not like normal pretzels, not bad but not as good as regular pretzels. The beer cheese was really good.  The crispy chicken sandwiches were really good. Just what I was looking for. The steak fries were exactly what you would expect. The staff was friendly inside and its like the biggest parking lot ever so parking is no issue.  I didn't take any pics cause they're entire menu and food selection can be found online.

The waitress was nice and consistent. The food was really good. It was quiet and not too packed. The ginger bread milkshake is flipping awesome (highly recommended). The fries were a bit soggy but bearable. The burger was really big. Could only eat 1/3 of the burger in the restaurant. I don't usually come here but will return soon.

For a chain restaurant my experience was a good one, I like their seasoning and they've got it table side to smother your fries in, make a mayo sauce with, and add extra to the burger of your choice. The messier the better I always say, so what if it's a bit all over the place and difficult to eat, it tastes good! If it tastes good I keep eating no matter how wet and messy it gets. I've got a beard to soak up the flavor ya know- bring it on  I give Robin 4 stars if I'm judging it knowing full well what it is and what it needs to be.   But I probably wouldn't go out of my way for this over a local spot, or even my own home, however maybe I should invest in a batch of their seasoning.

This new chicken and waffle sandwich is really good. I'm not a jalapeño fan so I requested no jalapeño relish and requested pickles (on the side) just in case I needed to balance out the sweetness of the honey basted fried chicken breast. The bottom waffle got kinda soggy from the honey coated chicken but overall, the sandwich was delish! If my sweet potato fries weren't served to me cold, I would have given this meal another star.

Wow! I think I just found my new favorite burger spot. My close friend wanted to grad a bite after work and she suggested Red Robin. I'm so glad she did! We both have similar taste in food and so I suggested we both try a creation burger; meaning, one we build ourselves. The contents of which were: grilled mushrooms, blue cheese, cheddar, bacon, and a sunny side egg to top it off. I also ordered the sweet fires and a root beer float to top it off.

-- Wait For the Hostess to come back to the podium.. Meanwhile the restaurant was not busy.. -- Wait for the Waitress.. Who look like she was disheveled..  -- Simple Order Two Beers Two Burgers.. Guess what again wait.. Actually had to remind the waitress about the beer..  -- Food was ok.. I have been to this Red Robin several times in many years and at this point it has bottomed out... And apparently looking at reviews here and on google I see that many agree...

Service is horrible. Place was empty, and it took forever to order and receive our food. Pretty much tasteless too. Not worth the price. Won't be going back either. After reading the reviews of this place, there seems to be one common theme.....the service. Mc Donalds has better food and service. Don't waste your time or money.

I love Red Robin. The burger choices are plentiful. I love the bacon avocado burger the most, though i have enjoyed several others. The onion rings are delicious as is the shakes.  I love coming here with my family. My wife has celiac disease and this is one of the few places that we can go where she can actually enjoy a bun with her burger as they have a gluten free bun. This alone gives them an extra star.  I take off a star due to the iffyness of service. If you come at the wrong day and wrong time it seems to take forever to get your food and your waiter may be nowhere to be found.

Writing this review kind of late but better late then never. I went to this location on a Sunday afternoon with my son. As you can imagine, the place was packed with families enjoying a nice Sunday outing. Although is was packed I was seated within 5-10 minutes. The booth that me and my son were seated in was kind of small and at times uncomfortable but considering that seating was limited at the time I just stuck it out. It took a few minutes, but eventually the waiter came to the table to give us our menus. Our food took about 15 -20 minutes. My son got the turkey burger with salad, which he really seemed to enjoy. I got the salmon burger with salad as a side. The salmon burger was good. It was even topped with fried lemon pieces (which doesn't taste as bad as it sounds) and some type of citrus/chipotle sauce. The salad was just an average garden salad; it was great but it wasn't bad either.I also got the low calorie lemonade which was ok. My server was friendly and attentive.The bathroom wasn't bad but probably not as clean as I would have liked it to be. Overall I had a good experience.
I love this place great burgers and fries restaurant is cool great service and I would go back any day for a quick lunch yummmmmmm

Great place.  Consistent.  10 things that are good for kids.  Full beer menu.  Burgers are good even without buns.  They also have the met game on.  Not sure if that's a good or bad thing.  Highly recommend. Ask for Natalie.  Our server.  She is great.

If I could give zero stars I would. This place is so unorganized and the food was disgusting. The burger tasted like frozen meatballs shaped into a patty in a bun. It was the worse burger I ever had in my life. I rather go to McDonald's. The waitress never refilled my drinks or ever asked how was everything. It took about 25 minutes for me to grab her attention that I was ready to order. She didn't even hand me my food someone else did.. Red Robbin "Yummm" my ass.

Was in the mood for some burgers yesterday and drove by Shake Shack but decided not to go in because of their crazy line. We decided to hit up Red Robin and that was the obvious great choice here. We were immediately seated for 2 right away and our waitress came to help us. She could obviously tell we were feeling delirious because we were so hungry so she helped us choose some good gourmet burgers (A1 Peppercorn and Southern Charm) along with a Blue Moon Belgium White and some waters. When she told us she would help request them to expedite our order it actually felt like she did that! We got our steak fries out first within 5 minutes of sitting down and our burgers came out about 5 minutes after that. We were so impressed by their speed and were even more impressed by how good the burgers were! I'm a bit disappointed at myself that I did not choose to come here first but all in all I'm coming back for sure!!

Where are the waiters?! A server only helped us once to take our order and disappeared to not be seen again. I ordered the red robin burger with a beer. Burger was good but they gave me a tiny portion of fries. What is this.. Fries for ants?! I didn't mind since it was "endless fries" but it ended after the first cup since the waiter never came back to check in on us. Service here is poor and saw many other frustrated patrons. This establishment seems to have adopted to technology and relies on the kiosk on each table to do everything. I will not be coming back.

I've been dining at Red Robin for years; I love burgers! I don't know if it's new management or what but this facility has grown steadily worse each time I go there. Slow service, unkempt restrooms, unattended spills, etc. Find a better venue on your next visit.

This place really stinks when it comes to wait times.  Host says 30 minutes,  it ends of being an hour or more. As I am stilling waiting to be seated, There is a large table of at least 20 people they are still waiting for their food.  I think it time to leave!!!

Wow, what a terrible experience today. The place was not full, but it took 10 minutes to for our server to first greet us. Got our order wrong, asked for a cheeseburger but got a plain burger instead. Asked for a refill on the drinks that never came, and never got another order of fries as requested. The server was a nice guy, but nice does not cut it when you're hungry.  And  the place was not too crowded, so it's not like he had so many tables to serve. Face it, Red Robin is the place where waiters get their first waiter job, If they can make it here, they move up to Friday's, if not back to McDonald's they go.

I'll keep this short and simple. If you are here for just burgers, go to shake shack. Red Robin's burgers are seriously over priced but that's because they subsidize the all day happy hour deal and the bottomless fries. So if you're coming here to put down couple of glasses and eat ton of fries, you've made the right choice. Just burgers? Me thinks not.

So yeah, I've actually stumbled upon a Red Robin!! Yeah, that burger joint with the infectious jingle, yknow? "Reddd Robbinn -- yumm!!!" Yeah -- that jingle. Anyhow, now that that's out of my system I can start with my review. Ahem!    So while driving for work, I spotted one and and told myself I just had to go check it out. Upon entry I was greeted at the door and was then asked where I would prefer to sit. Being alone, I naturally opted for the bar. At the bar I was being greeted and serviced by a pleasant gentleman (yes, I forget his name). I proceeded to be the nerd I am and inquire a whole slew of questions regarding the establishment as a whole. Why aren't there more of these around and where is it originally based out of and that sort of thing. He was very nice and knowledgable when replying to all questions which I must say is quite impressive.    Fast forward. I scour the menu and to my surprise, albeit they specialize in burgers, never in my life have I seen such a menu. The menu so extensively dedicated to umpteen varieties of the hamburger. I loved it! Haha! I then become indecisive 'Drew and start asking nor questions even. I told him what I was into and all and we started to meet halfway until I stumbled upon the 'Burnin Love! With a name like that, I expected nothing but a salivating mouth with each bite I took. The 'Burnin Love is a burger topped with jalapeño coins, salsa, pepper-jack, lettuce, tomatoes, and chipotle on a cornmeal kaiser roll. Ironically enough one the menu its description is concluded with a concise, "it's love at first bite".    Boy oh boy was it just that! I loved every bite of it! Best of all, I tasted every single ingredient listed. That's cool to say when slot of times you eat something from a restaurant and you don't taste half of the ingredients they say are in the dish (for whatever reason). I loved Red Robbin and the cool act I forgot to mention is that they also offer beer pairings! That's right! Not wine, but beer pairings to go along with the burgers! I'm more of a water with lemon fellow when I go out, but this was certainly cool to know!   Although I've yet to go back to Red Robin, I will when I get the chance again! This is a great place for any real burger lover! Wash one of these bad boys down with a beer and you're on your way to heaven in a bun! Now that's saying something!

I would not return here. Came here on a Sunday night and was seated by the bar. I waited 35 minutes for my food to come out and it was wrong. I then asked for some fries and that took 25 minutes. I'm currently still waiting for my other re up on fries. How does this place offer bottomless fries when it takes over 20 minutes to come out. I hated my experience here. Absolutely hated it. I needed a refill on water and walked to the bar because our server Caitlin was texting away. The service is awful.

I'll focus on the food first.  My burger at over $11 was an average-sized patty on a bun with a slice of cheese and two scrawny bacon slices on it.  It's one of their specialty burgers that's supposed to have lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, onions, etc., on it.  When I pointed out this specialty burger wasn't special at all, the manager (who bused the burger to our table!) said why not.  I pointed out all the missing elements and he walked over to our waiter and he must have made a joke because the waiter glanced back at me and laughed.  I watched (kitchen was visible from my seat) as the manager slapped, literally slapped a piece of lettuce and a slice of dried up tomato onto my burger.  The manager brought it over and smirked, "how's that?"  I was truly astonished.  The contempt of this guy was so obvious I asked my waiter what his deal was.  The waiter vanished after that, probably out of embarrassment, and we ended up not receiving parts of our meal and anything we did get was sloppy and unappetizing.  We sat and watched groups of customers come and go all the while asking for the bill and never saw our waiter again.  We've gone to Red Robin often and have noticed the quality of the food and the attentiveness of the wait staff going more and more downhill every time.  They have lost a customer for life.  No one should go out for a meal and feel intimidated or abused.  Shame on the manager and shame on Red Robin.

First time going to red robin. Never again. Food was okay. Service was absolutely terrible. Hostess was not cheerful nor welcoming. Seemed like she hated her job. We were told 15-20 min wait and we waited over an hour. Server rarely checked up on us and didnt have manners. Food was ok. Never again.

Would not go back and will not recommend to my friends... they ran out of there famous burger, we asked for water with lemon and didn't get it. After a long day of shopping we ordered 2 beers.. they arrived 36 minutes later.... Over all they were running out of everything. We got 6 fries with our order. Was very excited about going since I had seen the yummy commercials but after our experience there... it's just not worth it.  There are many other burger and non burger places to go to... Not Worth the wait !

This place is a great alternative to fast food, the price is comparative.  The fries are bottomless (free refills) as well, and the food is tasty.   They have a wide veriety of sandwiches to choose from.  You can add any topping on the menu to any sandwich.   My favorite is the California chicken sandwich with sweet potato fries.  The food is always fresh and comes with great service.  They have a full bar, for those looking for a drink... This location has a private parking lot, with plenty of spots.  This is not the place if your looking for a fancy or upscale place to dine. Nevertheless, I would recommend this place to other... Happy Yelping...

I come to this Red Robin all the time ! The last time I came my experience was bad. Came tonight thinking maybe this time will be better than the last. OH BOY did I think wrong !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! So my husband and I were greeted by our server, order was taken. The food comes out my order was wrong. My husband's onion rings were so COLD. No exaggeration. I don't believe in sending food back to the kitchen, but there was no way we were going to eat those onion rings. So I told the server they were cold, and of course the kitchen re drops the same onion rings. When they come back. They were hot. But now it just taste like old oil. Now my food comes. Chicken sandwich was good, fries were soggy. The fries at Red Robin are bottomless. I wanted more fries, but my server was nowhere to be found. Where my husband and I were sitting, if you look back you can see a reflection of what's going on in the server station, and the kitchen. I looked back, my server was back there talking, the MOD was eating,and yelling she needs a runner. If the other servers are busy why can't you run the food. I'm sorry are they disturbing your precious lunch break. At least I know why my food was cold. Anyway, I had to ask another server for more fries, at least when I got these fries they were hot !! After my fries were given to me, my check was given to me as well. A check I never asked for. !!!!! So I guess that was my servers way of saying "GET OUT" ! I really wanted the donuts for dessert. But by this time I totally lost my appetite, and just wanted to leave. This place has gone to SHIT! I ask the hostess to speak to a manager, and all she had to say was " i'm sorry about your experience, would you like me to get the donuts for you to go, or would you like a gift card" No I don't want your stupid donuts or gift card because I won't be back. If  you look up Ratchet in the dictionary Red Robin on Old Country Road will be the definition.

love this place.  Its close to my house and there are TV everywhere to watch sports.  The people that work there are very friendly.  The burgers are okay.  I love the bottomless fries!  and to keep kids entertained they have these tablets on the tablets you can place games on for $1.99 charge.  Getting the check is convenient you can pay right on the tablet so you don't have to wait for a waiter to come.

We go to Red Robin often. The staff is awesome and the food is great. If there is ever any issues with anything the staff is very accommodating. I wish there were more Red Robin restaurants around...as long as the staff is as good as the Carle place one

My boyfriend and I came here on a Thursday evening at around 5:15pm. However we ended leaving before even getting a chance to eat the food that we ordered. The restaurant seemed empty and we were seated right away. Not long after that, our waitress came by and introduced herself and took our drink order. I ordered  a diet coke and my boyfriend ordered a strawberry lemonade. The drinks took a little while to come out, which was strange since we didn't order anything special. About ten minutes later, our waitress came back and took our entree order. We sat around waiting for awhile for our food to come out. What was even more odd is that customers who came in after we did got their food and were enjoying their meal, while we waited. Meanwhile our waitress never came back to update us on the status of our food. Maybe another 15-20 minutes goes by and the manager finally comes out and tells us that our food order was served to another customer and they had to remake our food. So we decided to wait, since we were told our food would be out shortly. Another 15 minutes goes by and we still didn't get our meal. I ended up tracking our waitress down to let her know we were leaving and we wanted to cancel our order and also to give us the check for the drinks that we ordered . She tells me she was going to call the manager over. So by this time, my boyfriend and I left our table and we were waiting by the door for our check. Just to get our check, that must have taken another 10 minutes. The manager then comes out with our order in a to go bag. We told her we didn't want the food at this point and just wanted to pay for our drinks. I would be curious to find out how this restaurant functions when it is much busier. Trust and believe I will never go back to this restaurant again.

My husband I decided to stop here for a burger. We were seated right away as long as we were ok with sitting at a high table in the bar area. The server was busy but she came and got out appetizer and drinks order right away. About 10 minutes she came with our drinks and pretzel bites. We then order our food. 40 minutes alter we were still waiting for our food. She came over to tell us she was sorry. We told her forget it just give us the check. That took another 8 mins before that I went to the front and asked to speak to a manager. Thank god I wasn't holding my breath because the manager never showed up. I told the greeter to tell the manager forget it I will call the corporate office instead. I just remembered WHY I haven't been to Red Robin in so long!!!!!

Me and my brothers love burgers. So we decided to try out these "gourmet" burgers. We came on a Friday around 7pm, wasn't that packed. About 6 of us total. Got a table right by the kitchen which I always hate. But it was fine.  Some of us like our food, some of us thought it was okay. I'm not a big fan of bread, and I chose a burger with thick artisan bread. I asked for my burger to be medium. I got medium well. The burger itself was good, their endless fries with the seasoning were delicious.  I thought my experience could have been better, but our waitress wasn't at all that friendly.

The Red Robin in Carle place was ABSOLUTELY  HORRIBLE! We were celebrating my Father in laws 81st birthday. To start the waiter spilled an entire tap beer 24 Oz. All over me and my husband.  The appetizer plates were never cleaned off the table and when the waiter came to clean off the table HE knocked over the plates and the sauce for the onion rings. He also knocked over the empty beer glass which almost broke. We waited 40 min For our food to finally come out and all our food was ICE COLD! HORRIBLE SERVICE! The manager didn't even offer to pick up our bar bill. We didn't pay for the food and didn't eat the food!!! HORRIBLE,HORRIBLE,HORRIBLE!! DO NOT RECOMMEND AT ALL!!!!

My family recently dined here and I have to say the service has improved immeasurably in recent years, friendly and efficient. I suspect the improvement may possibly be a result of the survey you are asked to fill out after paying your check on their tabletop Ziosk device. Also, the wait time for your food to arrive (not the wait staff's fault, as I pointed out in my most recent review) has been reduced drastically. So all in all, a very enjoyable dining experience. Try their Classic Mini-Wedge salad. Delicious. You might want to share. It's more filling than it looks. We ordered two for our party of three and couldn't finish it all. In this case "mini" is not quite so mini.

Went to Reeeeddd Robin (sorry guys, temptation got the best of me) today. Whenever I come to this location I am usually greeted with kind employees, and quick service.  With a wide variety of burgers, fries, and sauces, I usually try something new whenever I go to Red Robin. Today was the Royal Red Robin burger (regular bacon cheeseburger with a fried EGG on top!) Initially I was skeptical when my wife tried it in the past, but today I took a chance and really enjoyed it! Milkshakes are usually good here also. The beers available are blatantly posted on a chalkboard, so you can't miss it, along with prices, so you don't have to go down the line with a waiter/waitress and ask the price of each beer.  Overall, great experience!

Horrible.  There was no hostess, so we waited.......and waited...... finally asked a server passing by, said he would send someone, so we waited........ and waited...... just as we were going to walk out, someone showed up.  As we walked to the table, the place was a complete mess.  50% of the tables were not cleared off from the previous customers, and there was garbage all along the floor on the way to our table.  I used the ladies room..... and guess what..... another disaster area in there as well.  FILTHY.  The toilet paper dispenser in my stall was broken, I had to use the roll that was sitting on the floor.  Our beer had arrived when I got to the table, well....... ONE of them had, and after a few minutes, it was taken back and delivered to another table.  When the beers FINALLY came, the Blue Moon did not have a signature orange slice. The waitress said she would go get one.  She never did.  Our burgers came, they were OK, that's it.  I had approx 6 french fries, that were soggy, cool, and it was a mix of two different types of fries, which led me to believe that they were from other peoples returned plates.   We left there so completely disgusted, they should seriously consider closing their doors.  BLECH!

Very disappointing. Server was abrupt and forgetful.  Skimped on napkins. Burger and chicken were sub-par. And to top it off, a mid-meal visit to the restroom was absolutely disgusting and made me lose my appetite. I'll leave it at that.

Overall a fun place to come for burgers. I came on a random day during the week with a coworker and the waitress immediately guessed we were on our lunch break and suggested bringing our food out quickly and all at once. We definitely appreciated that. I got the Hawaiian teriyaki burger which all in all was pretty good. I've been here a few times and can honestly say the service is consistently great and the food, delicious. What more can you say but yummm.

Nothing bad about this place, except the service sometimes.  The burgers are great and who doesn't love bottomless everything. The steak fries. Bottomless. The side salad. Bottomless. The milkshakes. Bottomless. It's heaven. I've had most burgers and the Cali Chicken sandwich, yum. The only one I didn't like was the Mac n cheese burger which had some sort of chipotle sauce in the sauce of the Mac n cheese which totally took away from everything else. No bueno!  The onion rings are some of the best I've had and topped off with their delicious ranch, ugh, I'm getting hungry just thinking about it.  So the only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is the service isn't always great. The servers seem put out that they have to bring more fries or salad or whatever it is you ordered. They aren't friendly at all. But prices are good for great food and since they have the ordering computer thing on each table I don't even see why the servers are even present except to drop off food. Still love it.

THREE STRIKES!! I came here to order a cheeseburger to go. The first strike was when the bartender put his own selection of cheese on my burger instead of asking me what I wanted.  The second strike was when I had to wait what seemed like an eternity (about thirty-fourty minutes for my order to come out.  The third and final strike was the poor temperature of my food.  Must have been sitting there for quite sometime. No reason for the delay since only a handful of other customers was in the building at the time...

May I suggest you skip this place and hit up the chipotle next door. If they are closed, try the New Balance store as I am sure their leather sneakers would taste better then the burgers at this place. Too bad, the place is really nice inside but not only is the food gross but the staff is incompetent. We arrived at 12:30 for lunch and was told there would be a 10 minute wait despite the place being mostly empty. The waitresses were "backed up". We sat at the bar where the service was adequate at best. Our waitress was not friendly but not rude, just sort of going thru the motions.  Too many burger options to settle for this place.

I decided to stop in here today with my mom, craving a burger. The place opens at 11am, we came in at 11:15a. Placed our order. The waiter Christopher comes our table like he has an attitude taking the order. Then had to wait forever and a day for refills on the fries. I dont understand it wasn't busy. He only came by the table once. Never asked if we needed water or anything else. The food is good but the service is horrible

Tried the A1 Peppercorn burger and classic cheeseburger with fries. The quality of the burgers were very good and certainly live up to the gourmet title. Although I ordered my food to go, the ambiance inside was welcoming and the staff members were very friendly. The restaurant is also located in a great location with plenty of parking. Plan your next family/friends hangout at Red Robin.

Terrible experience waited an hour and a half for food waiter was horrible never checking up on us or other nearby tables. It's sad because I really like Red Robin but I will not be going back to this location.

I can not understand how this place is still in operation. Granted the food is great but the service in non existent. We waited 15 minutes  for 2 iced teas, 1 coke and 1 milkshake. Coke and milkshake were delivered after 15 minutes and the iced teas took another 10 minutes. We ordered some appetizers and they came out about 15 minutes later. Although there was no utensils or napkins. No quite certain how we were supposed to eat the salad without a fork. It took another 15 minutes before we could attract the attention of anyone who worked there. Plenty of busboys and waitresses standing around but only the shift supervisor seemed to actually do anything but stand there ignoring the customers. About 30 minutes after ordering our burgers, we saw them placed on the pass and they sat there and sat there and sat there. After 10 minutes, we asked if we could have our food and we were advised that it wasn't ready just yet. 10 more minutes and the food was delivered. Surprisingly it was luke warm and only missing one item. We did ask for no mushrooms and surprise they were still on the burger. We paid our check on the little kiosk machine and surprise again, no receipt paper. We asked for a copy of the receipt but we gave up after the bartender who said, "No problem. I'll get that for you. Just give me a minute", and then spent the next 10 minutes trying to figure out how to change the channel on the tv. I can't imagine torturing myself again for a burger.

I ate here with my wife and 15 month old daughter. I had a burger, my wife had the chili and our daughter had the grilled cheese.  The service was terrible. The waiter was very confused and never brought my wife the bread to eat her chili with. I was already done with my greasy, salty burger and my soaking wet fries when the bread finally came. The grilled cheese was inedible. It was so salty we didn't eat it. It was overpriced, poorly served, greasy and was an overall terrible dining experience. Stay away!

Christina the server recommended the twisted tea and said it was really sweet.  It was delicious.  I also came here with a birthday voucher so my burger was free.  We also ordered an order of onion rings. The onion rings here are great plus i love the way they come stacked it just looks adorable. The burgers also come with UNLIMITED fries... One can definitely overindulge, but i was content with what the order came with. I will have to return again!

I haven't been to a Red Robin since 2008 and this was a worthwhile return.  The staff were pleasant enough and the food was fine. I had a tavern burger that had some type of an interesting sauce on it and a side of broccoli instead of fries.  The burger was a little overdone, but certainly tasty. My broccoli was a little scorched, but perfectly eatable.   There were a few little things with service: We weren't offered more broccoli or fries even though they are supposed to be bottomless. And my refill on iced tea was lemonless.   I don't know that I'll be rushing back soon, but I tend not to eat at this type of chain anyway.

The burger wasn't bad, and all the fries you can eat. Doesn't matter because the fries are terrible, I doubt if anyone asks for seconds. Run of the mill frozen fries are better and I don't recommend them either. Sorry, I looked forward to going Red Robin but I was highly disappointed.

location: Town of Hempstead, Long Island, NY
review: This is a really great burger place I've been to several burger places and so far this is my favorite if you aren't in the mood for burgers you can get a nice chicken sandwich like the Marco Polo ! I had quite a few different burgers here. so far my favorite one is THE BILLION DOLLAR BURGER another great thing about this place is the unlimited fries you can eat they bring you a small metal cup of fries and if you want more they'll bring a small basket of fries and and keep bringing you another small basket everytime you ask. And one more thing if you are a member of their reward program you get a free burger everytime for your tenth burger no matter what the price is for your burger the lowest priced burger is free.

Ehh..I've had to lower my expectations for food and sometimes service moving to NYC. My burger was okay, nothing special. I got a salad with it and same thing with that. My bf got a burger and fries, when he got his order he thought I had eaten some of his fries because he literally only got about 7 fries. We asked our waitress for more fries and she came back with a basket of maybe 11 fries..really?! So much for "bottomless fries." Also, after we got our food our waitress seemed to disappear from our section..that brought her tip amount down.  We were disappointed with this meal, we won't be coming back here.

Ok. I hate giving neutral reviews but with this one is a mixed bag of mishmosh. I have been here plenty of times and have received amazing service. But I have also came here and received crap service. The food here is mediocre to say the least. I enjoy how you can customize the food to your liking. That makes this place enjoyable. But let me tell you, the food is a hit or miss. The only thing that is consistent is the onion rings. The burgers are alright. Sometimes it is undercooked too much and sometimes it is overcooked to paper. The toppings and combinations of them are what makes thing place amazing.  Royal red robin with an egg and bacon is great. The banzai burger with pineapple and teriyaki sauce is my wife's favorite. A good balance between sweet and savory. The ghost fiery burger (not the tavern burger) is my favorite. It is spicy, but off balanced by the savory of the burger itself. I substitute the jalapeño bun for a ciabatta bun and it gives the hotness of the jalapeños a notch down. The jalapeño coins though are not that spicy to begin with. This place is good. Service is a hit or miss. I come here often because the food combinations are not offered eslewhere. It is definitely worth a shot but if you are not in the mood for unreliable service don't come here. The weekdays are the best day to come here.

First Time here..first of many!was greeted right away by hostess and seated in the almost  full dining room,pretty cool dining room,Very Americana if u will:)so our waiter was Adam he was a great server from beginning very attentive informative and kind,started w the tortilla chips w zesty ranch very good and only 3 bucks!WoW!lol for lunch I had the smoke n pepper burger wonderful presentation Sooo damn good along w the steak fries it's no wonder this place is famous for their burgers Wifey had the southern charm burger she thought it was a little too pink inside but still enjoyed along w her tasty sweet potato fries I washed everything down with a potent Petron margarita and a icy cold Miller lite The bill was very reasonable when I'm in the mood for a good  gourmet burger I will be coming back here and requesting Adam!

Just wanted to take a moment to compliment the staff and management of this location. We came in with a party of 8 at e tail end of lunchtime and were seated immediately. My nephew has Autism and one of his triggers is a screaming baby. So, of course, there was a screaming baby in the restaurant while we were ordering. The parents of the infant obviously didn't understand that a shreiking infant is not conducive to a pleasant dining experience. My nephew needed to leave, it was too much for him (and all 7 of us as well). We ended up asking for our meals to go. All the staff and management were very apologetic (and I understand that they couldn't do anything about the crying child) and ended up discounting the meal which I was not expecting. I felt bad for my nephew AND all of the other patrons there but I did want to commend the staff on how they handled the situation. I took off a star for the speed of service which was slow.
I use to go to other burger spots for my cheat meal....but I stumbled here and never looked back! Delicious times 10!!!

I returned with my wife to Red Robin for dinner. We ordered a $15 special of 2 tavern burgers and a appetizer.On the face it appears to be a bargain but after we ordered we found out the tavern burgers are about the size of a Big King although they were tasty. There must be a very small tavern somewhere to accommodate these undersized burgers. The onion ring appetizer was half sized and required another $2 to be upgraded. I then ordered a milkshake which was tasty and quite large.Service was very good and responsive. The price to value ratio here is below average for this type of restaurant. All in all this was an OK experience and I should be back in the future but not for this "special".

The first time we came to Red Robin last year was on a weekday during lunch.  It was crowded and the servers & kitchen were overwhelmed.  We must have sat there for 25 minutes before we even knew who our server was.  Our food came out slower than a 3 legged sloth and we ended up missing the start time of our movie. Fast forward a year and things are running pretty smooth these days. Burgers are great as well as the appetizers.  I'm glad they've stepped up their game and I can give them a decent review. This time for starters, we ordered the jalapeño corn dogs (5 mini dogs with chips) and a shorty stack of onion rings, which came with some good dipping sauces.  Around the table, we ordered the Whiskey River BBQ burger, A1 Peppercorn, Chili Chili Cheeseburger and I got the Bacon Cheeseburger.  You're asked how you like it done, pink or no pink.  For burgers, I like mine a little more towards well done for the crunchy exterior of the patty and they delivered without drying out the meat.  Each of us ordered a different side of steak fries, salad, steamed broccoli & cole slaw because they were free refills like the soft drinks and we were able to sample them all.

I came here for lunch because it was my birthday and I joined the Red Robin Royalty Rewards program. I was seated right away. Waitress and trainee were very nice. I ordered the bacon cheeseburger and Peach milkshake. Both were good, the milkshake needed to have a little more peach. I was not charged for the burger or fries. $4.39 was my bill. Great price for lunch.

Today was my second visit at a Red Robin location, and I was extremely disappointed.  When we walked in, there were several parties sitting in the waiting area.  We were told the wait would be about ten minutes which didn't seem long considering the amount of people sitting in that area.  As we were waiting, we saw at least eight tables that were empty but have yet been cleaned for at least five to ten minutes since the prior party had left.  When we sat, we looked over the menu and our waitress came over to take our food and beverage orders.  Our drinks took about 15 minutes before they arrived to the table which is very long for a few sodas and some waters. We had been then waiting thirty minutes till our server came up to the table to tell us that the food would still be a while longer.  She offered to bring out some fries for the table and we gladly accepted as we were starving.  The only problem is that she never did bring out the fries.  The manager was walking around and we called his attention to make him aware of the situation.  At this point we have been in the restaurant for an hour and have not had a bite of food.  I feel the manager was the largest problem in the establishment because he did not do well with customer service.  He was not very understanding and told us the food would be right out and they were putting it on plates, but even then it took a while.  When our food finally arrived, we still did not have any napkins or utensils on the table so we then had to wait for those which also took a long time.  The thing that I was most disappointed in was the fact that the manager never even came over to the table once after the food came out to see how everything was or if we needed anything else.  He was completely out of sight since the first time he came over to us.  The food was not very hot which questioned why it took so long.  I know Red Robin prides themselves in being "bottomless" for many things but even to get a refill of fruit which I am pretty sure came out of a can took about 15 minutes.  The food was definitely not worth the price we paid, as there are many amazing burger establishments nearby.

Can't even comment on the actual food because my boyfriend and I walked out before they even brought it out. The bartender was SO unbelievably rude from the second we walked in there. We were not even sitting down and she was already complaining that they close at 11pm and to order right away, yet it was only 10:20pm. She continued to make remarks under her breath saying she will never get out on time as other customers walked up to the bar. My boyfriend tried to order a milkshake but was told no & yet again reminded us that she had already cleaned the machine because they close at 11. Sadly I will never be going back there due to the horrible customer service. The manager could have cared less that she treated us that way too. If you don't mind being spoken to as though your inconveniencing the staff with your presence, than go to Red Robin on a Friday night and expect -5 star treatment.
Reasonable price for decent quality. They have the best onion rings in Long Island.  Family friendly.

The service is absolutely terrible here. Why does it take 15+ minutes to get a second order of fries, but when I ask for another order of fries to go, I get them in under 5?  The menu is very extensive and you can't go wrong with this place. The food tastes good and the price is right. They don't give you a hard time asking for a bottomless option to go, in fact they offer it to you.  However, the service is bad here. From the hostess to the waitress to probably the kitchen, everything is so slow. I don't know if I came on a super busy night, but it was a Tuesday, so I can't imagine what a Saturday is like. They were slow to take orders, the kitchen was backed up and asking for anything after placing our initial order was just near impossible.  Come here if you're looking for a cheap meal, just know what you're getting yourself into...

came here for the first time and ordered the Southwest Grilled Chicken Salad but it was DRENCHED in salad dressing.  It was more like a cole slaw than a salad.  I ate the other stuff (chicken, avocado, etc.) and left most of the salad behind. On a plus, the waiter was nice enough to comp my meal after I asked why it was so soupy, even though I wasn't asking for a comp and just letting him know for future reference.

I went with a friend and it was her first time to Red Robin. I think that made my experience more exciting than other times I have been to Red Robin's other locations. We tried the different sauces with the bottomless fries. And we split our burgers in lettuce wraps. Note, it is incredibly difficult to split burgers in lettuce wraps. It ends up looking like a salad. However, the food is delicious despite the messiness.

Ok, I'm kind of giving this review relative to my experience at another Red Robin in the Poconos.  This one was not nearly as good.  We waited some time for a table even though they had seating since the host couldn't figure out how to put the tables together for our party of 8.   Food was fairly standard, burgers were done well as expected.  The salads that some of our party got however came out terrible.  Limp lettuce, bitter veggies, not a good way to go.  They should really also invest in the touch screen tablet station that the one in the Poconos had since you can order drinks and pay your tab there with a credit card for convenience.

Dropped in here for lunch and, instead of waiting for a table, dropped anchor at the bar in the care of Simon the bartender. An appetizer of stuffed&fried mushrooms and fried zucchini was great, with the vegetables tasting very fresh.  I had the guacamole bacon burger (with mushrooms), and my dining partner had the tavern double burger, both of which were cooked to juicy perfection and paired with well-prepared and seasoned fries.  Beers were incredibly cheap, and a cookie magic shake as a to-go dessert completed in stuffing me. Service from the bartender was a little difficult, just because of how slammed he was making drinks, but where he missed the servers waiting for drinks at the service area of the bar made up, filling in and getting us whatever we'd asked for. All in all, I got a lot more than I expected from Red Robin, and I think I'll be back soon (cholesterol be damned).
Walter was slow , bathroom paper dryer wasn't working , told manager . He did fix right away.

Usually a great time and good food and service but tonight was not good at all!! Yucky food and blah service. I felt like I was bothering my waitress. I don't think I would come back on a Monday night!!

location: Town of North Hempstead, Long Island, NY
review: I returned begrudgingly at my partners behest. We came on a Saturday and after 8:30PM. Everything tastes great and our service was phenomenal (our favorite waitress was there thank goodness for Kim P.!!). Asked her regular schedule and we will only return on days she is here.

Red Robin is a fun dining experience for a group of friends or families expecting to find a joyful and plentiful dining experience. Fun way to enjoy a hamburger with the so famous"bottemless fries"(all you can eat fries). Ingredients are fresh and cooked to order. Different varieties of burgers will entice your palate and keep you coming back. Decent prices and friendly service makes Red Robin one of my family favorites to enjoy a nice meal in a casual, no nonesense environment.

Horrific experience.   Waited over an hour for burgers with a hungry baby, 20 mins for apple juice and was given stale fries.   Received our burgers pink and inedible.    The waitress was so aloof.   She was forgetful and hard to keep track of.   The one thing ai immediately noticed was that for that one section they had multiple food runners and servers but we were waiting forever.   Who knows maybe I was Hangry but an hour for crappy burgers still pink is no way to be.

The first time I ever came into red Robbins I had great service . It was 1/18/2015. I had no cash to tip out our waitress and I feel like a scumbag . Her name is Jen and she's a sweetheart . She sent back my drink and got me a beer when I said the drink was too sweet . Than my burger was too well done and she got me a new one with pink in the middle medium like how I wanted it . She was very pleasant and really sweet , I totally hope she sees this and doesn't think Im a bitch for not tipping I just ran out of cash . Next time I come I will leave her a really nice tip . I just want her managers to know also she was great . And the manager that brought My burger was a real joker i thought it was funny that he tried to say my burger was burnt to get me like what ?? But he wa totally kidding and I thought that was funny .

This joint has some of the best burgers in my opinion. I had ordered the Red Robin Gourmet Cheeseburger and it was delicious. The beef patty was juicy and warm. The chef prepared it really quickly and with precision as I wanted medium rare and I did indeed get that. The fries are thick cut and so tasty. I will definitely return to this place and recommend many people to come here.

First time at Red Robin was a fun experience with a couple of my girlfriends. Once arriving to the restaurant we were asked if we were all over the age of 21 in which we were, so we were seated upstairs in the bar area. The table was cozy and in a great location to watch baseball games which were playing on multiple flat screens. The ladies and I had a round of drinks and we also took advantage of our free refills and ordered separate drinks on there free refill menu. Our waitress was sweet & really made an effort to help us all with a burger choice. Since they were so many of us I won't go and say what we got individually, so I'll say what I ordered. I had a bbq burger with bacon, cheddar cheese, sweet bbq sauce (which was delicious btw), lettuce and mayo. The burger also comes with caramelized onions, but since I'm not a fan I had them removed. The girls and I were super happy with our orders and very much enjoyed the refills on our soft drinks and fries.
