Here's the problem, after we received our meal & some refills it was Incredibly difficult to find out waitress. When you arrive, on your table there is this tablet like accessory in which you can order your food, call the waitress from it, order dessert or drinks, even view your check & pay via card. So I'm assuming the waitress excepted us to use the tablet for anything we needed. Maybe I'm old fashion but I like the waitress coming over, just in case I have questions.  Here's when I get upset, once we finally got her to come over I ask her for our check, seriously it took her 23 mins to come back with our check! That's insane. I saw her doing other things which I really don't mind, but I also saw her laughing it up with her coworkers and at a point even looking around like she had forgotten something which in this case was my check. I was so upset, I ended up walking over to her as she was glazing at the stars and said can I please have my check again! She apologized gave me my check and took another 15 minutes to come pick it up from our table. That is the reason why I gave this Red Robin a 3 star review ! I don't mind the tablet you guys use to order or pay the bill but I do mind the lack of importance the waitress gave my party at the end of our dinner. Maybe I'll rethink going to this red robin & I'm sure I speak for the rest of my girls.

Very disappointing. Typical of chains, they have this ridiculous rule that limits their burgers to "no pink" or "some pink." A medium rare guy won't be satisfied. Fries are "steakhouse stye" which means forget about crisp. Pickles and onions were a challenge to get.  Specialty sugar free drinks also miss the mark. The server was pleasant enough when visible. I won't return.

Love the food, but service overall brings it down.  I fell in love with the food on my first visit, and have been here to eat for my birthday for 2 years in a row. The atmosphere is fun and lively, the music isn't too loud, wait times are fair, and as long as you can tolerate the just AVERAGE to at times below average service, you will have a nice time.  First off, the food is EXCELLENT. Always fresh, always hot, always nice and tasty. The food quality gets an easy A+.... but now onto the negatives... While the wait-staff is just NICE enough, I have sensed a certain pompous nature with them on almost all of my visits. It's like these young hipster types think they're working at a 5-star Manhattan elite restaurant as opposed to a chain burger joint in the suburbs. I honestly felt like punching one of them in the face during one visit.  Common sense things like having bottomless fries yet not giving customers ketchup at the table occur often. Your waiter will disappear for elongated periods at a time without stopping by to ask how things are or if you need anything (if other restaurants can do this, why can't Red Robin?) And I have this hunch of a feeling that they wait staff is actually trained to **NOT** immediately bring the second helping of the "bottomless fries" feature that makes this restaurant so popular. Seriously, your second helping of fries, which are technically free, will have you waiting so long that you'll lose your appetite for them. I'm thinking this is done **PURPOSEFULLY** to psychologically deter people from ordering the second helping of fries so the joint doesn't have to spend as much on them. It only makes sense.  More patient types will enjoy the place better than those who aren't as patient and have less tolerance for annoying pet peeves. So if you are a patient type, go check it out, you'll likely have a nice time.

Worst experience and terrible service. Waiter was no where to be found. Losing our order takes the cake, then to come back out with cold food is even more outrageous!!! The Manager seemed eager to avoid us. I'll be avoiding this place from now on.

The burgers and sandwiches at red robin are great in my opinion, quick well cooked and get to the point. That's where my 2 stars come from  The service here is horrible. When you come and sit at red robin, know you will be sitting and waiting and waiting. I ordered the chili con queso for appetizer and it was like warm, I waited and waited for the server she never came back around I just ate the thing. The burgers come out, 2r had ordered a side of onion rings, and we get a side of fries, we waited and we waited to correct this..NOTHING. we reach a pi j t where we run out of cokes and we are literally drinking the melted ice we look around and we look around other servers see we are looking around, we go unnoticed or unacknowledged. Finally I can't take it anymore and I stop someone, honestly all I needed was a glass of water. Out server FINALLY comes by when we are done w the meal we ask for our check and to get the onion rings off, of course this took another 10 minutes. I don't understand why this place is like this. The service is so horrible. The place want packed  it was 7 on a Sunday night.  Not worth the aggravation

Great burger joint. Burgers are large, and tasty! Have been here a few times, and by far the Bleu Ribbon Burger is my favorite, on a jalapeno cornbread roll.  The fries are alright with a little bit of their in-house seasoning which is placed on every table so you can season to your liking. The best item on the menu I've had at Red Robin, believe it or not is their Winger Lager Milk Shake. It was a gutsy move, but the idea of 2 of my favorite types of beverages mixed together intrigued me. And yes, it was amazing! Sam Adam's Winter Lager, and vanilla malt shake = heaven.

I admit that I am one of those people who flips out (in a good way) when a food chain from another region makes it way to the Northeast.  Yes, I was one of those people who was super-giddy when Sonic popped up (better than driving to Jersey) and now when Red Robin appeared.   Last night I visited this location for the second time.  Surprisingly, there wasn't a wait which is unusual since this place is usually pretty packed no matter when you go.  Their heat was malfunctioning but I had a fleece on so I survived.  The waiter took awhile to take our order but I let that slide, too.  The tower of onion rings was good but I could only finish two since they're huge and fried, and let's be honest, I barely (if ever) eat fried food anymore.   I got the burnin' love burger.  The only spicy part were the jalapeno chips.  The rest of the burger was juicy and good but definitely not spicy.  My friend had the whiskey BBQ burger.  He enjoyed his but he doesn't pick apart food the way that I do.  With that said, this place is pretty cool and laid-back but the service is lacking.  Your waiter will pass your table three or four times before they even take your drink order.   I do like the variety of burgers here, though.

I used to look forward to coming here. The food is really good. However, their service is mediocre and has recently gotten worse. I have a peanut allergy and have to be extremely careful about what/where I eat. I recently went to pick up a take out order. The first 4 times I called in no one answered. When I finally got connected a bartender, I placed the order and stressed that I have a peanut allergy. He read the order back to me and everything was correct. When I came to pick up the order, I realized why I had to wait so long when I called in. There was one bartender working behind the bar doing EVERYTHING, including serving drinks, answering phones, and running back and forth to the kitchen. They should have one or two people dedicated to manning the phones and taking orders.  When I checked my order upon arriving, the appetizer I ordered was wrong. Instead of giving me sweet potato fries like I asked for, they gave me jalapeno poppers. To make matters worse, when I told the bartender, he said I could keep the poppers and I didn't have to worry because everything was GLUTEN FREE. I said, "Gluten free? I told you I have a PEANUT allergy!!" I really love the food there but due to recently downfall in service and lack of communication, I will not be coming back anytime soon.

I've been coming to this place a couple times a year and I'm always satisfied. The food is delicious and unlimited steak fries! The catch is that the portion of the fries is quite little, it also takes a while for the order of fries to come. Other than that the burgers are on point! May I suggest the 'Royal Red Robin' and the 'Towering Onion Rings'. Also it is a hit and miss with the waiters and staff. I got one waiter who wasn't even there most of the time, the other time I got one of the best waiters I ever had. Availability on parking is pretty good as it's located right next to the mall. During peak hours it can be quite packed and the longest I had to wait was 30 minutes. Other than that I do recommend this place! Great burger and fries spot.
Came a half hr before closing time sat for 15 min at table not being served while staff yapped in the kitchen. Never went back again.

First off I have been coming here for a few years now and it never dissapoints. The atmosphere is perfect if I am lone with my other half or with the entire family.  The longest I have ever waited for a table was about 45 minutes and this was in the peak of the sumer on a saturday night around 7pm. If you have kids they are kid friendly. They have ballons for the kids which is very nice.  I actually come here rather than Shake shack nearbye since it is a kid friendlier place in IMO. They have booster seats and high chairs available.  THey have a full bar if you are looking to have a drink with your meal. The bar section is away from the main dining area but, it is in view of the entire restaurant. Recently they added some craft beers to the menu such a Smutttynose all day IPA.  I have only had several of there delicieous burgers and appetizers never any of there other dishes.  The milkshakes are awesome and the large can accomadate 2 people. they have even split the large shake into 2 cups for us in the past.  The service is great and I have to say I have never had a bad experiance with staff.  Parking in the frin is usually ample and the way the spots are outlined leaves enough room where you are not flush againat the surrounding cars. there is more than a foot seperating each vehicle.  The prices are also reasonable.

I came here with my family on a Saturday afternoon. Although it was not crowded, my waitress was very slow. It took her 15 minutes after we were seated to come by to take our order. It took an additional half an hour for our food to come out. The onion rings and fries were good. The burgers were ok. They didn't taste that fresh. All in all, I would suggest stopping in here to eat only if you are not in a rush. The service is extremely slow.

Every time I've been to this Red Robin it's been nothing of a great experience and good burgers.  I've had the cookies n cream shake, rib niblets, pretzel bites and my favorite go to burger: Royal Robin Burger.  Honestly the niblets and pretzel bites and meh but shake was delicious!  My burger is always cooked how I liked it. In particular to my burger the egg is hit or miss. I like the yolk to run (the best part I think) when it's a miss the servers always don't mind bringing me a nice runny one.  (today Kristen made sure of it I greatly appreciated it)  Fries I've noticed come in smaller portions which is annoying Bc I have to ask for more refills.  Freckled lemonade is unlimited and DELICIOUS don't forget to order it!  Maybe I'm just lucky but I love Red Robin and the birthday burgers I've enjoyed over the years!

Love hate relationship...burgers are amazing as always. I love the royal burger. But i ordered to go and got ONE napkin in my bag....which is unacceptable due to the size and how greasy these burgers are.... Most importantly they only gave me about 10-12 steak fries with my order.  I understand when you eat inside the restaurant its bottomless fries but when I am taking my order to go...you need to put more fries then that i am sorry.

It's a chain burger spot. Carle Place location very convenient and easily accessible by public transportation if you don't drive.  Staffing very friendly. , but today I think they were under staff because the wait for our beverages and one appetizer was a forty-five (45) minutes.  Then an additional 45 waiting for our food. What's disturbing, as we patiently waited.  Other tables that came after us. Seated. Received their food before ours. Much larger parties the same. Just when we asked for  management. The manager came with our food. Meal order was soup/sandwich combo. Definitely love their bottomless fries , broccoli. , and refilled beverages.  Took home prime chopped house burger.  Bagged my chicken Ceasar wrap., couldn't finish it after having my chili.

Went there tonight for dinner. This isn't my first time. For a Sunday afternoon the wait was decent. For a party of 6 we waited about 20 minutes.  Our waitress came about a minute after we were seated and Ordered salsa and guacamole for an appetizer. Came fairly quickly. Although our entrees took 30 minutes to come out our waitress apologized and said the kitchen was backed up. She offered to bring fries for the whole table while we waited. I thought that was very nice of her! I don't know why it took so long because I looked around and the restaurant wasn't packed to capacity. Burgers were delicious!  We ordered the chocolate brownie with ice cream for dessert. It was ok. Could have been warmer. Didn't taste fresh but we still ate it.  I would definitely go back.
Food and shakes were fantastic! Service wasn't that great, we were seated right away but waited over 10 minutes for a server to take our drink orders

Atmosphere is okay. Very loud during peak hours. Towering Onions are always yumm, but can be consumed by 5 people! The only burger I've tasted from them is their veggie option, and it is delish! Their mixed drinks are terrible. I'd say go with something a little more well known like a water or a beer. The fries are good too, but watch out! They're bottomless!  Definitely a great place to chill with friends/family. Very laid back, even the service is slow at times.  Happy eats!

This is just a review for their burgers. Their red robin burgers have thin patties, but you can add an extra patty for less than $2. Even other chains such as Applebees and Unos have thicker patties. They did cook a 'medium' burger right. The flavor is OK - not impressed, but it doesn't have me running back there. The plus is the touch pad they have on every table - you can place an order and/or pay your check without having to flag down a server.  The bottomless fries are a treat. Although they come unsalted (salt them yourself), the fries are warm with a good crisp, which makes them addicting. Grand Lux is across the street and their burgers are much better. I haven't tried anything else on the menu but I'm guessing it's pretty standard stuff like any casual fast dining chain would serve.

I have been to this location several times.  Service has always been the issue.  Spool slow.  When you order extra fries,  it takes longer then the actual meal.  Tonight, there was a special promotion, so we expected a bit of a crowd.  We were there over 5 minutes before a host greeted us. People waiting, and tables were dirty.  Only go here if you have Tim we to spare.

Free birthday burger during your birthday month! Besides that this Red Robin location is usually hit or miss. I was obsessed when it opened years ago and didn't come back until recently. Surprisingly still a bit busy during a weekend late lunch/early dinner. --Mini Onion Ring Tower - Crunchy and good enough for 2 of us.  --Whiskey River BBQ Burger- Always my go to burger. Its hard to mess up cheddar, fried onions and bbq sauce. --Banzai Burger: Pineapple is probably the best thing about this burger. Our waiter had a bit of an apathetic attitude, but delivered us what we needed (unlimited fries) when requested. I've been here at times when the service stinks and food is bland.  Luck of the draw pretty much! Better burgers do exist out there, but I can't complain this time since half the meal was free!

This was a gem in plain sight. The burgers . Fries & onion rings were awesome. I also had two mango margaritas on the rocks ($5.50) . Really tasty & strong surprisingly. It was busy but everything was hot & speedy. We also had good service & Great prices. Can't complain at all.

So, this is my 2nd time at Red Robin. The 1st time I went was sub par, but I thought, hey! let's give it another chance. Bad decision! After we were seated by the kitchen, my sis and I looked through the menu and decided on what to order. We used the little doohicky on our table to call our server over. OMG the waiting time! They pretty much forgot about us as we sat there for 10-15 minutes with the red light flashing on the table kiosk indicating attention from our server. The manager must have noticed, so she came over to help us. We ordered and again OMG the waiting time! Every time we saw food passing by we would get our hopes up. Finally the table server came to us and apologized for the wait. She said that she would bring us some fries to nibble on as we waited for our food. Five minutes later our ordered food came out. As for the fries that was supposed to tide us over until our food came out? Didn't see it until we were almost done with our food. I even felt bad for the family at the table next to us. They were waiting for their food for 20 minutes! Not only that, when I went to the restroom after my meal, there was no toilet paper in any of the stalls! *Sigh* So overall, I don't think I'm ever going to go back to Red Robin unless I'm desperate and I have half a day to waste.
This restaurant is ok. Been here 3 times. It's pricey for what you get. Burgers are thin and just ok. Fries are bottomless pit portions small. I didn't like the onion rings but my husband did.

I had dinner here on a Saturday night and was happy with the food and the staff. I've been to a few other red robins but the staff here was definitely better. I ordered the royal burger, the one with the sunny side up egg burger and with the bottomless garlic fries, I was quite happy about the meal. The pace of the meal was good and inquiries from the staff was right on. But the staff was attentive and friendly. Particularly, when I left my Nike sunglasses at the red robin. I called and was handled professionally and graciously by Christi, the store manager.

I went in here to have dinner this evening and I truly had a wonderful experience! My party and I did not have to wait long before being seated by a nice and friendly host. We were also greeted fairly quickly by our server which was awesome because we were all starved. The food was amazingly delicious and not really expensive considering the amount of food given. The managers on duty came to our table to make sure everything was going great and showed they genuinely cared about our experience that evening. All of the staff were friendly and the service was top notch. Overall, I'd recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a great meal with great service. I will definitely be returning again soon!

We have never had a disappointing burger at Red Robin.  The staff is always fun and attentive.  Prices are reasonable, the fries are never ending and we always love the different dipping sauces to sample.  And what better way to end a meal than with a Bailey's Milk Shake :-)

Had such a great experience in the Lancaster Red Robin that I was excited to try the Red Robin in NY.  It was horrible.  We ordered the Tavern Burger and was never told of the add on up charge.  She also did not tell us until it was too late that we could not request the burger be cooked med rare.  She refused to change the order. I requested my burger with just lettuce tomato grilled onion mushrooms and guar.  When it came it also was dripping with cheese.  I purposely did not request the cheese.  I was horrified. There was also mayo which I didn't request. I didn't bother sending it back but should have. As appetizer we had wings and kettle chips.  Wings were okay but the chips sucked.  They were cold and tasted funny.  We told the server and new chips were brought out again.  It was still cold and wet.  We also got the clam strip platter which was okay.  I should have just had the clams b/c the burger was a mess.   The waitress seemed overwhelmed and did not check up on us.  We went on a Sunday at 6 30- 8:00.  My sis said b/c of this experience she never wants to go back.  She stated that Shake Shack would have been much better.

**my lover has been raving on about this place for 2months to my daughta about coming here cause there arent many in nyc so we had to drive 40mins to long island for this family dinning a lil bit of a wait but the hostess was kind n great personality  -the burgers were good i could barely eat all of mines. all children seen to be having fun and all had the macaroni on their plates!!. also loved to see the towers of onion ring flowing to peoples tables and got devoured  -the cocktails were cute as well -scenery was cute family orientated  -very mixxy environment great experience for the anticipated wait ((my daughta loved the place)) signed i love to eat & i do it consistently mr.von teese & family **

Today was my first time having red robin and it was really good food. Service was great. I can't say i remember the name of my burger, i asked the waiter to choose his favorite for me. It was delicious, the spicy jalapenos made my night. Only thing, the fries were tough to eat after ten minutes of sitting. A good burger though, and thats all that really matters in the end!
Great burgers, great variety, great place for dinner!

I love this place for so many reasons  Its just damn GREAT ..  EVERYTHING IS FRESH & TASTY bottomless fries is cool if your starving and not on a diet  =0)  Staff is always friendly and quick  My GF always says "Red Robin?"  And its always "YUP!"  Great place "Thumbs Up"
Good as any other Red Robin. Tips: 1) get fries to start 2) try out the sauces - my personal favorites are the thai chili, camp fire, and honey mustard 3) keep getting more fries Red Robinnnnn YUM!

The first time I went here,  I ordered a decent and fresh Avo-Cobb-o-Salad because they were out of the California Chicken Sandwich.  The second time came, I finally got to order the sandwich I wanted and it was really tasty! I love the combination of guacamole, bacon, tomatoes, and juicy grilled chicken all between two pieces of toasted bread.  My chicken came out a little charred because of the score marks but it didn't affect the flavor of the entire dish. On the other hand, my friend C*'s burger was inedible! Her Guacamole Bacon burger was burnt around the edges. The staff were quick to resolve the issue and her second one came out perfectly! ;)  I ordered a side of sweet potato fries (yum!!) which were quite large and flavorful, The chipotle sauce I dipped it in was like crack. The fries and sauce went really well together (and I don't really enjoy fries that much).  I give Red Robin a solid three stars because its like any other generic all-American burger joint and it hasn't really wow'd me so far.
Awesome variety of burgers, bottomless fries, bottomless root beer float, good prices, what's not to love?!

Huge disappointment!! Was expecting a good burger . Boy was I mistaken! Reminded me of a McDonald's burger. Unfortunately I paid 3x the price of McDonald's. Service was horrible , waited over 45 minutes and the restaurant was 3/4 empty. The only thing that was remotely good was dessert . Will not be going back.

Any place that gives me good service like this place plus bottomless fruit flavored limeades and bottomless steak fries is perfect for me. I love the fact that they have a seasoned salt bottle on every table as well. The prices are good and now that the place is not brand new in this area it seems not to be as crazy as it was in the beginning. Don't get me wrong though, this place is very busy so be prepared to wait but the food and drink is really worth it. Try to get a booth too cause the High Top Tables by the bar area are not that comfortable.

I've always seen Red Robin commercials on TV and after a friend of mine told me one opened in Long Island, I had to come. Saturday was rather busy, it was opening week however. The wait was ~45 minutes which wasn't too bad. The atmosphere is friendly and very nice. My friend and I ordered the A.1. Peppercorn Burger. The burger was delicious and cooked to perfection. The fries were seasoned very well, and came with extra seasoning if we wanted to put on more. Highly recommend this place! The service could have been better. We were never offered a refill for our drinks and fries, and since the restaurant was busy it felt like they were trying to get us to leave as soon as possible. They gave us our checks RIGHT after we finished our food. I understand it was busy, but we should have been served better.  I received a red royalty card which gives me the option to purchase a appetizer, FOR FREE! That was pretty convenient. Prices are great too, two burgers came out to about 22 dollars along with tip and tax, a good 30 for two people. Would eat here again.
Best burgers! I'll be here when I crave some good burgers. They also have bottomless fries which is awesomeee!

I've been looking forward to trying Red Robin for quite a while. I always see the commercials but up until a short while ago, there were none even remotely close by. The hubby and I decided to finally give it a try, though I was truly in the mood for something from Cheesecake Factory. First thing upon arrival, its bright as hell in there, even Dave & Busters has better ambiance than this place! We were seated promptly and given our menus....it was about 11pm at this point and I believe they close at 12. Our waitress must have asked us 5 times if were ready to order, obviously she was ready to close up.  Finally, I ordered the spinach & aritchoke dip, red robin royal burger, and my other half the bleu cheese burger. We waited about a half an hour and our burgers arrived..did you notice I said my burgers arrived. What happened to our appetizer??!?!! She kindly explains to us that the chefs been having problems "defrosting" the spinach dip tonight...I asked her to scratch that off the bill. Its not that I was actually expecting it to be made in house, but, damn, I hoped for a tad better. I was kinda turned off at this point.  My so called "bottomless" fries totaled to about 12 fries in total and they were far from piping hot! Luke warm at best. We were never offered another round of fries. The burger was ok, but, you can tell its the generic frozen patties, totally unseasoned and uneventful. His bleu cheese burger was decent but once again the patty made it mediocre. My bill came...$40.11! WTF...for two burgers, one beer and a lemonade! Yeah, right! Come to find out she charged us for two desserts we never ordered. After that burger, the last thing I wanted was to waste any more money on their just above fast food level grub!!! My experience there was far from memorable and they'll definitely be a last choice for burgers. I had to remedy this bullsh*t dinner I had tonight...ordered two macaroni cheese ball appetizers, chocolate cake and banana cheesecake from Cheesecake Factory! Winning!

DON'T GO!  Service was so bad we walked out and this after waiting for our orders for close to an hour. When we asked to speak with a manager suddenly lukewarm food appeared...too little, too late. The first sign was I had to ask the waitress to wipe  the table as there was a pool of liquid across it. She badgered us for orders without giving us time to peruse the menu. Once we decided she was no where to be found and we had to call her over. She bought drinks, nothing else. We had to ask for cutlery as the table wasn't even set. She brought dirty and stained cutlery and dropped it in a pile on the table's end. She should be fired. The restaurant, if that's what it calls itself, should be shuttered. This was a total disaster that really upset our day and the schedule we'd set. We never saw a manager. No one appeared after three requests to see a manager. Oooh, and the bathroom was filthy.

Very pleased with the service, gluten free options and the food.  Best gluten free hamburger bun ever! GF Royal Red Robin and GF Red Robin cheeseburgers were very tasty.  Sweet potato fries are also GF and delicious.  Look forward to returning.

3 stars is generous. Please take a moment and read. The food was great! However, before placing our order, our server made a huge deal about the bottemless beverages and fries. Great. I ordered a Stella and my husband ordered an ice tea. We must have been waiting 10-15 minutes just for our drinks. SERIOUSLY? I understand if the place is popping and it's so busy. It was an average night. Ok. Fine. By the time we finished our meal it was about 30 minutes later from the time we got our burgers. Needless to say our server came and checked on us 1 time. She was so busy catering to the table next to us to us, it seemed that she completely forgot about us. A huge party of 12 came in and then she dedicated her time with them. Long story short, we never got a refill on the ice tea or fries and when we finally got her attention we just paid the bill and left without ordering anything else. I am a former waitress and I know that they rely on their tips. I tipped her below 20%. We will go back but we will be prepared to spend the evening there.

So, I have to say the food was not bad.  We all had one of their burgers. It came out exactly the way we asked for it. We also tried the wings. It was ok, we have had worst. The prices were good. The restaurant was clean and the service was great. We will be back to try again.

I've been here about 4 or 5 times.  It's dead on at 2 stars.  The food CAN be good, but it can be frustratingly bad.  The service is friendly, from what I've seen.  Maybe it's because we're from the five boroughs were we KNOW bad, apathetic service.  Anything reasonably proficient is okay by us.   Stay away from grilled chicken, it's not normal tasting, and we've had bad, rubbery, cold chicken.  Sad, because the Whiskey River chicken salad, wrap and sandwich used to be very good at all the locations I've had it at on both the West & East coasts.   Burgers are good.  Fries are good, but unevenly cooked sometimes.  Shakes are pretty good.  We had a server named Danny that was energetic and made good suggestions, especially the Guiness Beer shake.   IF YOU MISS RED ROBIN FROM OTHER PLACES, EXPECT TO BE SLIGHTLY DISAPPOINTED.  But if you're an RR veteran, you know to ask for all of your fry refills, sauces and so on to come with the first order, so you don't have to crane your neck for 20 minutes, looking for the waiter. This place is either sadly empty, or going through an unexpected rush.  I feel like they don't know how to staff adequately.  But seriously, I found everyone to be friendly and helpful.   Managers are all cool, particularly Kathie, who wasn't afraid to ensure we remained RR customers after a bad experience. This location needs to step it up, but they're doing okay for now.

Their food is pretty good, its a chain so its kind of the same at any Red Robin you go to. The service on the other hand is always hit or miss. Especially for a to go order, sometimes the take-out people flat out ignore you. I understand they're busy, but to not even acknowledge you? Its just not very enticing. But thats what you get from an average chain restaurant. Still fun for a night out and some quality fast food.
They were super dead and we wait 20 minutes to be greated. Worst service ever and the burgers aren't that great.

I have been to this location several times and I've never had a bad experience. I'm shocked this doesn't have better reviews! My "go to" burger is the Whisky BBQ and the meat is always cooked to my preference and juicy. When I want to get fancy I get sweet potato fries but the steak fries are just as good.  The freckled lemonade is a drink staple and they stay on top of the refills. I usually have to tell them not to bring me another one! I LOVE the mint brownie shake and they also have a really good root beer float. The RBF is also unlimited! I can never get through a second one though.  RR never disappoints and yea it can get packed with a bunch of families with their kids but who cares enjoy your food and when you're done unbutton your pants and be happy!
It's an ok burger joint. I had a blue cheese burger medium rare. It was ok. I would go back if I was starving in Carle Place.
It is what it is but ANDREW the waiter freakin rocks. Feel like I am at Metro 700 again.  Hahaha. Great service.

When I visited here for the first time, I gave 5 stars, but after the 2nd visit it went down to 4. First thing we had to face was a long wait. It was Friday night and the wait was about 45-90 minutes. This first attempt turned out failed. Second attempt worked out well, and we were seated after a 45 minute wait and a little bit of confusion between waitresses. The table and seats were wet from cleaning, and we had to ask our waitress to wipe the water out for us. Well, acceptable! A tower of onion rings and riblets were great. Especially the riblets should be an entree. SOOO GOOODD!!(left found that there is an entree of riblets. lol) I had Bleu Ribbon Burger which was AWESOME! Freckle Lemonade made of water melon was great too. This was a success and I gave it 5 stars! HOWEVER! My 2nd visit wasn't that pleasant. The wait was decent, but the waiter seemed to got drunk or tipsy somehow. We received utensils after we got our food and asked the waiter. The portion of riblets was not the same, and the burger was TOO SALTY. Fried onions in my burger was just too salty I thought someone dropped salt bottle cover and poured salt accidentally. This visit took 1 star away from my review! (but still I hope it was just a mistake and next time they will give me another great moment!) Therefore, I would give 4 stars!

I've been to Red Robin many times when I find myself in New Jersey.  I've always liked the restaurant as I am a burger and fries type of guy, and they have a nice menu insofar as that goes.   I was quite happy to find out one was opening up about a mile or so from where I work.  It took some time, but I was finally able to eat there.   My wife and I were greeted as soon as we entered the establishment and we were seated right away.  We arrived a little after 5pm so I though the place would be somewhat busy, but if there were more than 10 people there, it was a lot.   Our waitress took our order quickly, and we received our appetizer (Mozzarella Sticks) quite quickly.  So far so good.   My wife ordered the A1 burger, as rare as permitted, and I ordered a straight, no frills cheeseburger, well-done.   When the burgers arrived, my wife was satisfied with her burger.  No problems there.  When i bit into mine, the burger was still very pink and in no way looked like a well-done burger.  I called the waitress over and she too agreed that the burger was not cooked as I had requested it and she would have a replacement burger to me in "3 minutes or so." Lets just say this.  By the time I received my well-done burger, my wife was finished with her dinner.  Not quite 3 minutes.  More like 15-20.  Now under normal circumstances it might be understandable if the place were packed and very busy.  But in this case the place was quite empty.  I would have liked to eat with my wife, but sadly this was not the case.   The food itself was what I've come to expect from Red Robin, but the place still needs to work on the delivery of it's food and meeting the customers request to have it a certain way. Eventually I'll give the place another shot.  Hopefully it will earn a better rating.

This had to be the worst hamburger I've had in years. I came in ordered a simple cheeseburger and beer and walked out $20 poorer and wondering was I insane or had just been exploited. The beer was fine but the hamburger was undercooked, the roll subpar, the add-ons were nowhere to be found, and the fries were cold. Had I gone to the diner nearby I would have had a hamburger that would have overwhelmed me for 25% less. Had I not been famished and in a rush I would definitely have asked for my money back ! Disgraceful !

We went to Red Robin for the first time - anywhere or ever. Afterward, I came to Yelp to read the reviews, and was really surprised at all the criticism. We had a great experience - we loved our burgers and the fries were great. We each tried one of their specialty drinks (I had a freckled lemonade and my companion had a smoothie). It was a hot day, so it was doubly nice that the moment I was sucking down the last of the strawberry slices in my drink my waitress was walking toward me with a refill. The staff was really friendly and pleasant (although one of the hostesses was a bit overly chatty, but she was sweet and kind, so it almost didn't matter). Now. Onto the point of Red Robin - the burgers. We were extremely pleased with our burgers and really appreciated the ooey-gooey quality - hot, juicy, just enough fat to melt all over the place but not so much to be disgusting, and the cheese was melted to a state where it was soft and gooey and melted right into the meat. Other burger joints often either under-melt the cheese or toast it to the point where it's more like the cheesy crust on a French onion soup than a topping for a burger. The burgers are different at Red Robin, so I don't find comparisons to places like Five Guys or Jackson Hole to be quite fair. RR had the hot-ooey-gooey factor, but other places do better with the lean sort of ground beef and grill flavor. The reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because the menu has items on it that make it seem like RR is dependent on brand name foods/drinks that are processed somewhere else rather than being made in the restaurant and by its staff. Just a personal quirk.

I too had high hopes for this place, but after my third visit, I am now officially disappointed with both food quality (my 'medium' burger was pink all the way through and cool by the time i got it) and service (slow- even on an early midweek dinner visit)  On the plus side, the kids love it, as they can order from the pictures on the children's menu all by themselves.  Next time we want burgers we'll hit the Maccas drivethrough.

Nice to see Red Robin is back on the island.  I remember when they closed down their Queens and Long Island locations some fifteen years ago (maybe more).   For a while it became an out of town novelty ... being able to go back in time to mudslides and onion ring towers.  Well, they are back and in Carle Place.   Seating was tight near the bar (like two inches between tables), but service was spot on and they really kept the crowds moving on a busy rainy Monday.   Menu is just like I remember it with newly added wraps and other goodies.  The burgers were great and the endless fries, well, endless.   Our waiter was helping out from a Baltimore location and really knew his stuff.   I look forward to going back once the hype has dyed down.     Parking lot on premises.
Burgers are just ok. fries are good. Service is sloooow, particularly on the weekend. The place itself is not clean particularly the bathrooms.

overall atmosphere nice staff is friendly you get to watch football downside  they don't own a sports package so only watch it on TV prices are reasonable the shakes are on point what is very very good even the signature guess that one food and wine best South Beach for 2013

While the food was decent, the service was terrible. I ordered a burger on a whole wheat bun with garlic seasoned fries on the side. I got the incorrect bun and plain fries. My boyfriend ordered bacon on his burger, and and it came without bacon. We had also asked for extra lemons to go with our water and it took about 10 minutes to get those lemons. Towards the end of our meal, the waiter was taking the order of the table next to us when his pen flung out of his hand into my boyfriends meal. Instead of apologizing, he turned to one of the other servers to mention it... That was when he offered us a complimentary dessert. After telling him that we were not interested in dessert he brought the check and didn't compensate for anything. I would not recommend this restaurant or service to anyone.

Oh Red Robin, where do I begin. When I met you in Virginia you were so good. Now that you have migrated to Long Island you have lost your touch. At 3pm on a Sunday we were seated after 5 minutes. So far so good. We sat for about 10 minutes before being greeted. Finally our waitress "Chrissy" greeted us. She promptly apologized for the wait. We ordered our drinks and food right away. The drinks took a while and Chrissy kept apologizing for the wait regarding the bar. The food was delivered at reasonable amount of time.  The cheeseburger tasted good. The food quality is decent. The service was not good. It seemed like as a team everyone is disorganized and the apologies almost seemed like a routine that the server was used to.  I will be back Red Robin, but only to go next time.

GWould prob give an extra 1/2 * (thinks about it...eh, maybe not) RR opened up near me during the summer. Never been to one, only saw those commecials. After seeing folks waiting to get inside a few times my curiosity got the better of me and I took my daughter in. The service was good for the place being crowded. It's cutesy, fun looking inside-something like Dave&Buster-ish without the games. The food was good...however the steakfries were 'meh.' Server was bubbly and friendly. Most likely won't make it a place to eat at reg. Just a once a blue moon thing.

Came here on a not so busy late afternoon and experienced the slowest service ever.  First of all, when 4 of us came in the door, there were 2 hostess there chatting with each other and I'm sure they saw us, but they kept on talking and talking, when they were finally done, one of the hostess led us to a booth.  We had just came back from a long day of shopping at Tangers and we were all starving! Then later one of the waitress came over to take our order, we ordered appetizers, 4 entrée and just 4 glasses of water, normally, you would think they bring you the water first and right away right? Nooooopppppe, the appetizers came first, then a little while later, the water,  the worst part is they did not give us silverware at all, just a bunch of napkins, I tried flagging down the waitress but she's no where to be seen, so we ate our appetizers like barbarians.  When they came with the entrees, then we finally managed to get her attention and bring us some forms!   So during our meal, the waitress came and told us that she's going on break now, and the other girl Angela will take over our table.  We have no idea which girl is Angela, and by then we need refills on our water, so we waited and waited, finished our entrée without water, finally Angela shows up and asked if we needed anything?  We asked for refills on the water, she said sure and walked away.  Then another 15 minutes went by and no water, the whole time I was looking around for her to see if I can grab her attention, because I know for sure she forgot about our water!  Then I saw her come our way and I was like yes here is my chance to remind her about the water!! but no oh no, she went to the booth right behind us and started taking their orders, and chit chatting with them, asking for their names. then after that, she walked away really fast.  I had missed my slim window of opportunity!!  Then another 15 minutes went by, and all 4 of us were sitting there quietly protesting and we had lined up our empty glass by the edge of the table so maybe just maybe she sees it and remember!  So after waiting what it seemed like an eternity, Angela showed up with some water! hurray, "gulp gulp gulp" Long story short, took another 15 or so minutes to flag her to give us a check, which she never did, because by then our first waitress came back and ask if everything's okay and we asked her for the check and she delivered pretty fast.   Overall, slow slow slow service, I wouldn't be coming back here.  The food tasted average, I wouldn't spend 80 bucks plus tips to come to this dump ever.  On the way home, both my husband and I had to rush to the bathroom, so I'm not sure if it's due to their food, but most likely it was, because the other meal we had that day was at early morning before we head out to Tangers Riverhead from Queens.

The food here is okay - service is a whole other story. Been here twice - and both times the servers were really friendly and very nice. Unfortunately, this does not mean that they provide any service other than take your orders and bring you your food.  There are no napkins, knives or forks until you ask for it. You can be sitting there with your food and no one will notice that you have nothing to eat it with until you ASK. (i've only been there twice so maybe its a coincidence....but I doubt it.) Their "bottomless" fries are a joke. First time, we asked for more fries and waited so long, we just left. Second time, we asked for more fries and it took twice as long as it did to get our food.  We started wondering if this is a scam....and then the waitress comes over to mention that they are still working on my fries (really, how long does it take to cook ? .....) - and that it looks like we are all ready to go, so she can pack it in a box for us. I said "uh...ok". 10 minutes after that, she drops a basket of fries on our table. What ??  The other strange thing was that we were already done with our food for about 20 or 30 minutes, and you clearly saw that we were ready to go, but you didn't take anything from our table ?  Like I said, service was friendly enough - and its not like the servers were sitting around doing nothing. They were clearly busy....which leads me to think that this is a management and training issue.  Too bad because the food is pretty good. I just don't think its worth the aggravation and the time. I really wanted the mini apple bites but didn't want to wait 45 minutes to get them so I left.
It's a chain. Okay for a chain, and the burgers are good, but the place is better place for kids than Fudruckers (not as noisy).
Very pleasant service.  This place is VERY kid friendly!  Pretty decent burger and unlimited fries.  This is a good casual place very good for families.

The burger was good. The fries were awesome! I like the seasoning they have on the table. Opening week so it was veryyyyyyy crowded. They told us a 30 minute wait, but we were seated in 5. Very weird. Even so, the service was very good. I did not like being seated next to the kitchen as I could hear all the shit the waiters and waitresses were talking, lol. I will definitely be back again.

GROSS! It doesn't even deserve 1 star. We ordered onion rings, the onion fell out of the breading it didn't even taste like an onion, it had zero taste whatsoever. My husband ordered a bacon cheeseburger, he said it was greasy and didnt taste good at all, I had a chicken burger however, it wasn't  a burger of ground chicken, it was a greasy cutlet that you could tell was frozen, not fresh and it wasn't good. We went for lunch and it wasn't all the crowded where they sat us because I told the guy I didn't want to be packed like a sardine like the other side of the restaurant was. After he sat us he proceeded to seat  2 other couples right on top of us, meanwhile that whole section was open. The funny thing is my parents visited a Red Robin in another state and they thought the same of the food. We will never be returning.

Excellent food!  Love the variety of menu choices and the extremely friendly staff!  The manager came out to check on our table and was very concerned about the quality of our experience. Can't wait to go back!!
Nice atmosphere, kid friendly, but too long of wait for just burgers and the burgers were not too flavorful. A bit disappointing. Will not return.

The new Manager actually called me as did the corporate office.  I am impressed that they took the time and explained they are making changes.  Going to go back in a couple of weeks to see if service improved.  Hamburgers are really good as is onion rings so it's worth trying again..will update

Connor was just excellent. I came here for a speacial night out for my sons birthday. Nothing big because it wasn't his main birthday event but more of a mom dad son kind of deal. Connor came and treated us amazing. He checked on us periodically and not in the annoying way that you would expect but in more of a concerned way. He kept us posted with how long our food may be ready and so on. He was very knowledgeable on the menu which one may say well your supposed to be but believe me it's rare when someone actually cares about their job. Now overall the food was amazing, the wait was not bad at all. And the service was excellent. Will definitely revisit.

the food was very good been here a bunch of times but I was just there 2 days ago. the service was awful. our waiter never came around w waities so long for our food and even longer for the check. we were going to order dessert but we had wited so long for the check e ended up just leaving.

Nothing explicitly bad about the food and service. Had the unlimited sweet potato fries which were awesome. I've always like their sandwiches and burgers. Savory and flavorful. It's not going to bust your stomach but good eats. In comparison to other establishment (TGIF, Applebees, Ruby Tuesdays), I think this is the best out of them.

The hamburgers are consistently great. It's one of 3 places that I can go to for hamburgers and be completely satisfied. Every single time, the burgers, fries,and drinks are always great; and the atmosphere is fun. How can you not love it? I'm not sure how you can be disappointed in this restaurant. The only thing that annoys me a little is the inconsistent service. One day I can be helped immediately and others I may wait a while to have someone help me out. Other than that, I still like this place.
Absolutely LOVE this place!!! Great service and never let me down with their DELICIOUS burgers!! Wouldn't go anywhere else!!

I went there last night with my (2) children in hopes of getting a bite to eat. Arrived at 7:45pm it was full but moving, we were sat within 5 minutes.  I was ready to order, the waitress took our whole order in one shot.  We didn't get our food for 40 minutes.  Grilled cheese and apples Chicken fingers and fries Burger and fries I don't know what took 40 minutes because the food was ice cold, not warm - COLD I was hungry, my kids were hungry and it was late already so we ate it.  The cheese on the "grilled cheese" was cold not melted, they basically put American Cheese (the Kraft singles kind) in between two slices of buttered untoasted bread - YUCK! The fries were over fried and COLD, again - you serve burgers and fries why are they cold?! I promised my kids ice cream (now 9:30pm) almost 2 hours since our arrival with young kids is a long time - here comes a scoop of vanilla ice cream each and it was frozen, like freeser burn frozen and it was gross.  I have never complained about service in any place I've eaten but I couldn't NOT say something. The manager was VERY nice, and he did reduce my bill but I seriously don't know what's going on there.  I hope they get their act together.  There was a table with 4 ladies across from me - they sent their good back about 4 times and they couldn't get it right. Good luck!

Ok. Here goes. Im in the restaurant business. Have been for over 30 years. That being said i get it that some days you don't wanna be there at all. You are having a bad day. Your dog died. Your best friend lied to you. I get it. I do. I rarely go out to eat. I can't really afford it and i never have  a night off to go anywhere anyway so whenever i do get the rare chance to dine out i try and pick a fairly cheap place with decent food that is close to where my friends and me live so we can get there quick. I decided to go here tonight. I haven't been here since i worked across the street a couple years ago. I always enjoyed the food here. So we got there around 8pm and they remodeled the spot and it looks great. I was really impressed. I mean i get it, its Red Robin but still it looks great. We got a seat in the bar and sat down while waiting for a 3rd member but i we were ready to order right away. I don't know what was up with the spot tonight whether they were short handed or what and i understand that. We sat for a while and finally got our server to take our order. He was fucking miserable. I tried really hard to be nice and friendly and joke around and he was not having it at all. Me and my gf ordered our burgers and drinks. We never got silverware and had to ask 2 different folks for it. The food was good. It was. But man oh man i felt like we were annoying the guy and when we asked for the check he just shoved the machine at us. WTF man. We were polite and nice and respectful. Didn't ask for anything crazy. I hate the fact i got treated like shit. The female manager was very nice she got us our refills and other things we needed. Im not gonna out the guy since im not about getting people in trouble on Yelp but for real man, try and crack a fucking smile. Life is hard i get it but we are nice and fun and you could've had a good time with us and got a way better tip then being a miserable fuck and hating us. Won't be back. No thanks.

Would've given 5 stars but they forgot our onion rings and didn't get it until midway through our dinner. However, wait staff is very attentive. Floors got a little slippery at the end of the night so watch your step. Steak fries were flavorful and crispy. Burnin' Love burger wasn't spicy at all so you're better off customizing with the ghost chili sauce...be careful: it's SPICY. Flavored sodas are all delicious and they have endless root beer floats!!! Desserts are uber sweet, if you like that sort of thing but it was too sweet fore and it was drowning in a strawberry syrup soup... Great simple burgers done well, reasonable price and great endless promotions.

Last night, after not going to a Red Robin for over two years, I was remembered why I think it has gone from a great burger joint to "meh".  I got in the restaurant and sat in the bar. I waited a couple minutes for the server, ordered my food and then waited, and waited. Finally she came back at about 25 min to tell me food was almost done... Then another 5-10 min after that it finally arrived.  I had a Royal Red Robin burger. Burger came out the exact way I ordered it! But the Garlic Parmesan fries were luke warm and not fully cooked. Plus for an extra dollar for garlic seasoning with no Parmesan cheese it wasn't everything I'd hoped for.  She came back about 1/2 into my burger to ask how everything was. I said, "The fries..." And she finished my sentence, "Aren't cooked!" I replied, "Yep, can they remake them?" Then I finished my burger and waited like 5-10 min for fries. They were good on arrival but at that point I wasn't even really into it at all. I ate them to be polite.  The only things I enjoyed were the milk shake I ordered at the end of the meal to drown my sorrows and the waitress for not being mean but honest and polite when I complained.  I won't be back to Red Robin.

I have been to several Red Robin establishments and this is by far the worst one.  Our burgers were brought out before our appetizers and we were promised fresh burgers would be recooked.  Well, that didn't happen.  Once we received our burgers they were overcooked as well as the fried egg.  What really hit the nail on the head was the fruit salad my wife requested which was rotten.  You can clearly see the mold on several fruits.  I have a picture I will try to upload.  This makes you wonder about the rest of the food.  When I complained about it, I was offered a substitute that never made it to the table. There seems to be a strong lack of communication at this Red Robin location. Our server was very unprofessional,  I witnessed him sit down at a table to take an order and complain about his shift. Twice another table's order wasn't to ours and the table to our left kept requesting more fries that just never made it to the table.  We went at my daughters request for a Birthday lunch and left in disgust without ordering any desert. I will be visiting any Red Robin restaurant in the near future and i suggest even refrain from doing so, as well.

Terrible experience. Waitress reeked of cigarettes and trashy perfume, tortilla soup was nothing more than melted cheese and a tub of sour cream, salad was soggy and brown. Turkey burger was okay. And the bottomless fries? Good luck getting more than one serving of 8 fries! Will never be back.

Love the new implementation.  Think it's finally in sync after working the kinks out of the system.  Love the new look to the place as well.  Great spacing, more lighting along with fantastic food as usual.  I even like the new self check-out counter at every table.  Helps facilitate all the transactions.  I know, most waiters usually rush customers to leave immediately due to wanting more tips along with traffic.  This new system allows customers to feel at ease and allow them to take their time instead of rushing to leave the restaurant.  Highly recommend.  As usual, the burgers are great, along with the bottomless fries.  In addition, they have this membership program where every 10th burger is free along with burgers on your birthday being free.  Highly recommend that considering there's a reward system now that's implemented.  Things are looking for this spot.  Try it out! I go here at least twice a month!

Love this place! definitely serves my burger cravings.  To begin with, their wait list system is great. You get a text when ur table is ready!  The service is not 5 star but its quick and the servers get their job done! On a crowded & busy day, they managed to get me my dish within 15 minutes!  The price is decent compared to other places. Avg of $13 for a burger..

I came here once out of convenience. My preggo sis wanted food ASAP, and as this is located in the same shopping area as Destination Maternity, it was convenient. Our server was very quick, polite and attentive (all my stars are for her). The food was typical (nothing to write home about).  The only thing that irks me about this place is the cleanliness. I looked around and saw plenty of utensils and food pieces on the floor; lotsa sticky looking surfaces and the bathroom surfaces were questionable.

They're lucky they have bottomless fries-if you can even get them! Been here 3 times in the last couple months and 2 of 3 visits, was disappointed with the slow and absent service. The waitress today took over 20 minutes before she came by to take our order, not even stopping by to ask if we wanted something to drink.  Half of the tables in the restaurant were empty. It took ANOTHER 25 minutes for our food, while stacks of food waiting to go out sat across the whole kitchen line.  The day manager instead of being active in the restaurant line of service, helping out the expedite process, paced around the restaurant spending most of the time looking out the front windows. It was like an episode of Kitchen Nightmares with the owner doing everything else but helping. His mind was elsewhere and I wonder what is going on in this man's life that is causing his lack of interest.  Don't work there if you aren't interested in the job!  The food isn't bad which is why you come here to being with. These aren't designer burgers from a boutique burger joint, although they share some similarities. The sweet potato fries are great. The younger male night manager is helpful, on a side note.   If you work at a restaurant, you need to put the customer first, expedite, feed the hungry customer yadda.... our waitress lost out on a decent tip because she didn't give a shit, so that's how this works.

The food here is pretty good, especially the fish and chips. There is usually a wait to be seated but if you get her at a odd time you can usually be seated right away. The make some decent drinks and the service is usually good. At least there is enough parking for everyone!

I am going to preface this by saying, I LOVE Red Robin as a chain. I love the food, I have never had a bad meal at any red robin and the food is consistently good. However, the service at this location? Atrocious. We have gone multiple times and have almost always been seated in the bar area. Not my favorite, but fine. However, twice we have gone there to have our appetizers be forgotten about, or have the extra pickles I asked for with my burger delivered to another table right in front of me. Fine. Whatever. People make mistakes. However, the last time was the final straw for us. We put our names on the list, and stood to the side. We saw a table for two who had come in AFTER us (by like at least five minutes) get seated before us. When I pointed this out to the host, he looked at me like I was an idiot and said I must have given him a different name since I'm not on the list, even though he had repeated my name back to me! Sorry, as far as I know, I only have one first name. Even the other table agreed we had been there first. The host refused and sat them first and then finally gave us a table in the bar area....again. We had our order taken relatively quickly, only to have our appetizer come out first and be totally finished before the waiter realized he didn't bring us drinks. And at Red Robin in the bar area, you almost never see your waiter, so I couldn't point this out. I'm not going back, and that's a shame since I'm absolutely obsessed with their crispy chicken sandwich.

3.5/5 stars Although its a chain burger spot, this location really surprised me and hence why I am taking the time out to review it.  This location (I dont know if it was new at the time or underwent new management or what) but their service was impeccable, super prompt and they were beyond efficient-especially on the Friday night that went.  Usually wait times are about 45 mins to 1.5 hours in Long Island at any restaurant but they had us seated sooner than initially expected and our orders were brought out without delay as well.  The bottomless fries, really are bottomless and a guy like me can probably have three potatoes in one sitting! The burgers are fresh, the sides compliment the meal, the strawberry lemonade was really good, and the fries with an assorment of sauces are really the star of the show.  Easy meal, well priced, you know what to expect when going in and you are given just that, but served well with a smile!

The food was great! Every burger on the menu is amazing. They also have a large selection for the kids menu. Beside burgers, they have salads, chicken dishes, fish and ribs. With their burger there is bottomless steak fries so you can get as much as you want.  The reason I only give it 2 stars is because of the very horrible service. It took over 10 minutes to get another order of steak fries. Then when I needed a refill it took over 15 minutes. The waitress passed my table over 10 without making eye contact without coming with my refill. I had to flag her down to remind her about the drink. The payment process took another 25 minutes from the time I asked for the check and actually paid and got back the receipt to sign. It did lot look like I was the only one upset as I heard  other customers complaining around me.
Every time I come here I get the best service. I love their burgers and I love the renovation.  This is my go to Burger place.  Keep doing great things.

Not a fan.  Was somewhat interested to try this place.  There was some hype about it, and one of my friends mentioned it was good. My friend was wrong.  It starts with a very long wait to be seated.  The famous  bottomless fries were gross! Maybe the worst french fries I ever ate they tasted really freezer burned.  The burger was oddly seasoned and lacked a true meaty flavor.  It was not juicy at all.  I think Ruby Tuesday's  Triple-Prime Burger is better.  Wait staff is careless.  This place was little more then a crowded, Mcdonnalds with waiters & waitresses.   Avoid this place. If your really in the mood for a burger place with cheap prices drive down the street to Ruby's.  And they have a salad bar to boot. Or even better,  GM Burger Bar in Rockville Centre.  If your already waiting and want a close alternative go to Ben's Deli right across the parking lot and savor a tasty Pastrami sandwich.

Finally. Well, now that my dream of visiting the fabled Red Robin has come to fruition I shall proceed with my review.  First the negative.  NO MORE TOWERING ONION RINGS!?  Really. Well, now that my dream of having this Onion Tower has been crumbled, wife and I moved on to their self proclaimed gourmet burgers.  Wife ordered the Pub Burger well done, which it was and I the Burnin' Love Burger, medium. Well it was well done. Nevertheless, both burgers were juicy and meaty and had a nice smokey flavor to them. I also had the parmesan garlic fries which were very garlicky, and very tasty.  The service while eager to please can be disoriented and our request for a fry refill took a long time. However, as our waiter stated, "we are still working out the kinks."

Omg def worth the visit food is great, service is great....and the drinks will make u stumble !!!!! Mr. Lennox the manager is def worth meeting he went above and beyond!    I will be a regular for sure!

sooooo....this review is difficult. ive only given them 2 stars, but i wanted to give them more. im not going to beat around the bush and ill just get to why they only get 2 stars: 1. service was terrible. our waiter was pleasant enough, but after he took our order...we never saw him again. we were there for a bit over an hour and he came around once to refill our drinks and once to ask us how the food was. he walked past us plenty of times...but would avoid looking at us as he went. 4 or 5 times i saw him just standing near the back talking to other wait staff people...not really doing anything. 2. the food. ok so we ordered the nachos, which were actually pretty good. they would have been better if our waiter had ever come by asking us if everything was ok so we could ask for salsa...but he never did so we ate it without the salsa. the big problem (and its a really big problem) was the burger. this place is a "gourmet burger" place, and they have lots of burgers that sound really good. since it was my first time there i ordered a plain old cheese burger. the waiter asked me how i wanted it and i told him...extra rare. my girlfriend ordered her burger medium.  when the burgers came hers was medium and mine was medium well. her burger had the slightest little hint of pink in it...and mine was a rubbery disc of charred flesh. i immediately waved the waiter over and showed him that not only was my burger not extra rare it was more done than my girlfriends medium burger. the waiter apologized and took it back saying they would make me another one.  a few minutes later...the floor manager came by also apologizing and proceeded to give me my new burger. i cut into it...and it was EXACTLY the same as the first one. blackened rubbery and medium well. it was at this point that i just gave up. i never did eat the burger and i wasnt about to to send it back a second time.   when the waiter finally returned to giv us our check i showed him the burger and said that it wasnt rare and in fact was just like the first one. he again apologized and then told me this...are you ready? : THEY DONT INDIVIDUALLY COOK THE BURGERS THERE...THEY HAVE THEM ON A CONVEYOR BELT AND THEREFORE HAVE NO CONTROL OVER THE DONENESS OF THE BURGERS. what?????!!!!!  are you freaking kidding me?  what kind of "gourmet burger" restaurant cant cook to order??? at first i thought it was because they just wouldnt make a rare burger (some places stupidly are like that) but then they should have said that when i asked for it extra rare. but no...its because they dont cook to order.  so basically red robin is an expensive burger king.  FAIL!!!!!

Quickly seated for a Saturday lunch (very nice hostess), checked in on Yelp and got scared with all of the bad reviews about the service...  but so far so good with our waiter Martin.  Friendly, conversational, and brought out drinks & appetizers extra quickly...  The food, however, is mediocre at best.  Wings with chips are okay, prime chop burger was decent, chicken tortilla soup tasted fresh from the microwave, prime rib dip sandwich was meh (stale bread).  Overall, good service but mediocre food.

Red robin is known for their bottomless fries  and their variety or gourmet(ish) burgers. I didn't really get that whole experience when I went with my family. It was Friday night, but the place wasn't that busy and we got seated right away.  As soon as our waiter came, everything was weird. He seemed to ramble on about what he is supposed to do as a waiter. We order our drinks first (i had the mint brownie shake). At the table we had two shakes, lemonade and a diet coke, and we didn't get any water until we asked which was when the meal came. I find water to be necessary, especially when I have a shake with my meal.  The food was not as great as I would have expected. I had the A1 peppercorn burger medium with a sesame seed bun (instead of the onion one) and it was good for the first couple of bites. But halfway through, the burger became really soggy and Ye bottom bun started to fall apart. At that point I started on the fries. We had 4 burgers at the table, with 4 "bottomless" fries but we never got a refill on them, nor on the water. It was an alright experience, but I hope next time I go the burger doesn't fall apart.

its one of those restaurants where you've seen the commercials on tv, the food looks allll goood and start to search and wonder..where is this??! i was excited to find out one was about 20 mins away from my house. ive been here a few times and held off on writing a review because i hoped my experiences would get better over time since they were new. the only thing i can say is that the only thing consistent about this place is their inconsistencies..the service basically sucks, no matter what waiter ive had..they either screwed up my order or acted like they were too busy to do their job.  -one time i had a waitress bring out 2 baskets of fries in advance so that we didnt have to ask and said that this was the "maximum limit" so she wouldnt have to come back to the table again. smh. lol..so is their policy of "bottomless fries and floats" true? -my recent experience, she asked how i wanted my burger and i told her medium rare..she said the best she could do was medium because that is the only way they cook them...sooo um, why ask? -_- Ive only had a burger once because i was scared of the aftermath effects to my body (heartburn, diarrhea, etc.), it scary to think they can stack so much stuff between two slices of bread, i guess no calorie postings are up here..eh?...salads are actually not bad, ill add another star on for that. i honestly wish this place could be better, it didn't leave the red robin "yuuummm" effect on me. :-/

I'll start by saying that I've loved Red Robin in the past for a suburban burger experience.  This location didn't deliver.  The restaraunt was crowded, but everyone was being seated and I'm sure it wasn't an unusual amount of people for a Sunday evening.  The service was SLOW, which is an understatement.  Our appetizers and drinks came quick enough after we waited 10 minutes for someone to come who didn't even turn out to be our waitress. But our burgers took forever to come with barely anyone coming to tell us the food was coming soon and appologizing (that came eventually).  In the time it took to get our burgers, I could have went next store to stop and shop and bought chuck steak, went across the street to the mall to the kitchen supply store and bought a meat grinder, set it up, ground the meat, formed it in to patties and cooked it and then go back to stop and shop, buy potatoes, cut them up and fry them. When the burgers did come, they were as I expected and remembered at other Red Robins in NJ and PA so at least that was good, but if I'm in the area, there's a very slim chance I'll be going back to this location.  There are other decent burger options in the area.

Don't even bother. Save your money and go to CHIPOTLE or FIVE GUYS. Never been so disappointed in having a burger in my life. Shakes are too milky burger was semi warm not hot and juicy. Had no flavor what so ever. Flame broil my ass. Tasted like BJs or Costo Pre packaged cheeseburger.
really awful food, loud and horrid experience.  YIKES  On the flip side the kids loved it - I won't go back - they can return when they can drive, and pay, themselves!

Happened to be in the area of a Red Robin popped in to take something home. Order to go one of their Red Robin Gourmet Cheeseburger with fries. Have to say pretty dam good. The place was nice and had a very friendly staff. Never had and burger and fries come in a red box before was really different i must say. I was surprised they even had a bar in case soda or water isn't enough. I guess if your in the area and want something that's better then McDonald's or Burger King give this place a try. Hey even if you don't want a burger or anything just go to the bar and get trashed and spray ketchup all over yourself.

I've been here a few times with the family and we've always had nothing short of excellent food and exceptional service. The staff is incredibly friendly from start to finish, and the only reason I didn't award this place 5 stars is because I felt sorry for the wait staff. The last time I visited Red Robin was on a Saturday night. Our waitress (cannot remember her name right now and it's driving me crazy) was very sweet and was sure to be attentive despite having to take care of so many tables. Having worked as a waitress through college I know how overwhelming a large section can be on a Saturday night. Our drinks arrived fast, the server was very knowledgeable about the menu, answering my sister's endless questions, and our food was served in a reasonable time frame for a Saturday night. My only complaint is that it took forever to get refills on the bottomless fries...to the point that I felt bad asking the waitress because I could see her standing in the kitchen asking the cooks for our fries and looking frustrated. She was very nice and apologized for the wait for fries, and was sure to stay on top of keeping those bottomless drinks coming in the meantime. My only other complaint is the clientele (yes I know that includes myself). This is where I really started to feel for my server. Like I said, I've worked in a restaurant so maybe I'm biased, but customers need to realize that the wait staff are people, not puppets. The people at the table next to us were extremely rude to our very sweet waitress for no reason. She was doing her job and doing it well. The poor girl isn't working for $3 to be treated like garbage and stiffed on the bill! I love Red Robin and I'll keep going back. The food is great and the service is wonderful!

I stopped by here around 1PM on a Saturday and sat at the bar.  I had great service there, my glass was never empty.  i ordered the bacon cheeseburger and was asked how i would like it cooked.  I told her medium rare, and she responded by asking if i want it pink in the middle, which is the definition of medium rare, so i responded yes.  When my burger arrived 10 minutes later, there was no pink.  I'm not really one to send food back so i didnt complain, but based on c.w.'s post sending it back wouldn't have accomplished anything.  The burger is a very good size, it definitely filled me up, and there was a good amount of bacon. Taste wise, it was nothing special.  You can tell they are frozen patties and aren't spiced at all.  Bottomless fries come with the burgers which i appreciate, but the fries here don't deserve a second round.  They are very generic steak fries, which i'm not really a fan of.  Now if mcdonalds had bottomless fries, i'd have a serious health problem.  $13 for a burger, bottomless fries, and bottomless soft drinks isn't a bad deal for a sit down restaurant, but i'd go to almost any other fast food place before coming here. i'd leave just as full and definitely more satisfied for less money.

Never been to a Red Robin before, so we tried it out a couple of times.  The burgers are not much better than Burger King.  The bottomless fries are thickly cut and not seasoned well.  You do have seasoning in bottles though, so I guess they're relying on you to do their work for them.  I did like the Prime Rib Au Jus - it's a generously portioned sandwich and the jus is not too salty.  The only memorable thing is the Limeade, which you can get unlimited refills for.  We got refills to go too.  Won't be going again, since Shake Shack is now down the road.
Love that you can substitute the meat in an meal and the bottles fries are a plus too! Only negative is that the staff is a bit slow.

This is the only place I've ever been where my takeout experience was better than my dine in experience. Our waitress was very nice, then she disappeared halfway through service, and we had a runner serving us for the rest of the service. Both were courteous, but there are definite kinks in management that need to be worked out.

Went there with a friend. We've never been to a 'Red Robin' establishment before, so we went in there with an open mind. My first impression walking in was nothing special. The joint looks like any other American chain 'applebee'ish ' restaurant. Place is fairly new to the neighborhood so i always give service and food a little slack. After we were seated, I had chance to examine the menu. Nothing out of the ordinary here. Typical American food with a decent burger selection. We figure to try the burgers since they claim it's "the best in the universe" FAR from it!  I got the 'burning love burger' because the waitress said it was good... ( which it wasn't at all ) and my friend got the 'red robin gourmet cheese burger'. We both asked for medium well done. Waitress comes and brings us our burgers and we also decided to try the mac n cheese. As we dig in, we noticed that her burger was rare. I decided to mention that to the waitress in her response tried to argue what medium well meant and did nothing about it but say that she went back and told the "cook manager to cook the burgers better. " she did not even offer to put it back on the grill or give her a new burger. And The mac and cheese was the worst i ever had. Extremely soggy. We left both our plates pretty much full. We also noticed people all around us complaining about how bad service was. A man was sitting waiting for a waitress to bring him a fork to eat his salad. We had no food so we offered him ours. And a lady walked out extremely upset mumbling towards me "this was the worst service i ever had". I had to agree with her. To top it all off ... I originally was going to give this place 2 stars but i was just informed there was also a hair in my friends fries that she didn't want to tell anyone to gross them out.  If you're in the area...
