Do yourself a favor, walk right past this dump and walk into the Chipotle next door.
The restaurant was understaffed and it resulted in lukewarm food. The dessert, bite-tini, was excellent.

We had a great time last Friday, even with a line out the door, it only took 20 minutes to get a seat for both of us. The server was great and the food was cooked perfect(light pink for a medium burger). And the bill was only $35 for an appetizer, two drinks, two burgers and a dessert. Idk what people are complaining about???! We loved it here! :)

Definitely the better of the chain food resturants! My first experience here was really great. I had a vegan burger wrapped in lettuce. Yes.. yes.. a chain store offers this. I was surprised, too! Endless fries, included.. which sorta.kinda balances out the fact that I subbed off the bun, right? ;) Not really, but I cannot give up my endless fries! The second time I came here, I think I just had a crappy waiter. He completed messed up my order, and the store was running 'low' on fries.. so, they weren't endless. That kinda defeats the purpose of coming here, so I was disappointed. I guess it is a win/lose situation. Either way, I really do love that they offer the option to lettuce wrap your burger! Just clever.. weeee! 8-)

So my sister is obsessed with burgers and had been raving about Red Robin for a while. One a trip to see the parentals recently my sister told me how their was a Red Robin open on Long Island now and that we need to go. We decided to get an early lunch here and luckily we were seated right away. I got the burning love burger which was pretty yummy and ended up getting the mac and cheese which was just mediocre. My sister got the bleu burger and I stole some of fries. The burgers are pretty big and the fries are bottomless so next time I would split a burger and fries with my sister and get an appetizer or salad to split as well.

so far...so-so like other reviewers, i was super excited to get a red robin nearby after having eaten at others out of state & being bombarded by commercials for years...after 2 failed attempts at visiting on saturdays (60+ minute wait...i don't think so), we were finally able to get in last night after a 15 minute wait the food at red robin lived up to the hype & to my memories...my banzai burger was delicious, the fries i got (read below) were great, drinks were cold & refilled a few times to my liking, and the apple pie bites for dessert were really good, super hot & crispy any and all complaints i have about red robin have to do with the service, which flat out sucked...it took a while for our waiter to even come over & introduce himself, let alone take our orders...after this drinks came pretty quickly, but it took forever to get our food, and the promises of bottomless steak fries never manifested - i remember being at red robin out of state & getting baskets of fries along with the first round of drinks while we were waiting on the burgers...this didn't happen, the portion of fries that came  with my burger was tiny, and i was never asked if i wanted any more...to make matters worse, the table next to us who were seated & ordered after us ordered one appetizer, yet received it 3 times before we got any food...in the middle of our meal the aloof waiter comes over to tell us that he's going on a break & introduces his replacement who was equally in outer space, then they proceeded to have a 5 minute conversation about god knows what while hovering over our table...i don't know about you, but for me trying to eat with two people i don't know hovering over the table is just a little awkward would i try red robin again? yes, but not for a while...the food was delicious, just the way i remembered it...but the service was not where it needs to be, and it wasn't just our table - while waiting for our food i watched 3 other tables have conversations with wait staff and/or management about the problems they were having, seems to be a theme...once they get things worked out i'm sure it'll be a great place to eat, but for now i'll stay away

I have heard about Red Robin for a long time, seen their ads, and thought...OK, national chain, theme restaurant. Let's hope that Red Robin can actually make a decent burger. So I went to this location, entered, saw their menu, and ordered an "Octoberfest" burger. A burger, which had ham, sauteed onions, melted Swiss, on top of large burger pattie on a pretzel bun. You sit, take a bit and go...OK. Its not too bad, its not exactly ShakeShack, or Five Guys, but its good.  The pretzel bun soaks up, the moisture from the burger, and your able to enjoy the burger with your "bottomless" steak fries, an iced tea, and a Sam Adams.  I'm not saying I am sitting outside a Red Robin with anticipation. But, look I Red Robin can do a burger, and a Jalapeno bottle cap. Could do without the rest of the place though, and constantly thinking of Chotchkie's from Office Space. But that's just me.
Fancy presentation of your good ol-burger and fries.  Nothing special - except the price and how you eat off  a china versus paper plates or burger wrappers. :D
Had  a Royal Red Robin, simply delicious burger nice and juice and staff was friendly.   YUMMM!!! Highly Recommend!!

Oh Red Robin... I loved you in Jersey so why don't I love you in New York? #1 reason is that you guys do not have the mango bango limeade. This is such an awesome drink that you guys need to get at this location which is the by the way the only Red Robin in New York. #2 the salsa and guacamole dip we ordered for appetizers. The guacamole dip was about to turn that muted green color almost brown nastiness. #3 our entrees took way too long to come to our table. We didn't have to wait for a table so why do we have wait 25 minutes plus for burgers? I was happy that they opened one up not too far from the neighborhood but if it ain't good, why would I come here? Hope the service, food and drinks get better with time. At least you still get the bottomless fries.
Service has improved 100%. This with the great food earned it a 5 star rating.
This restaurant is so average in terms of food and service.  I don't see myself going back to have their mediocre food.

Awesome burgers overall, I'm a sweet potato fry fiend and their sweet potato fries are good. They don't really sog up like other ones might... But for your own good don't order their Boca burger. I wanted to be a little healthier since I got their chocolate shake (great btw and so are their alcoholic bevs) and my first order of Boca burger was still cold! Obviously frozen so they took back the burger and I kept my sweet potato fries. They returned with a hot new veggie burger and a boat of fresh normal fries which was really nice of them. I expected a better veggie burger warm but it was still like downing bread on bread on bread. Service was good but just stick with the real meat for this one. I usually do but idk what came over me lol. The guacamole burger is my failsafe staple! And ask for their sweet chilli sauce on the side u won't regret it. I took off two stars bc of the fact that the service can be a little inconsistent. Three stars bc their burgers  and the bottomless fries are deathly but oh so good!

Food is good for a family burger joint.  It is a glorified fast food place. For fried food it wasn't that greasy. Friendly staff and love the fact of free re-fills and all you can eat fries .  Great place to bring kids.  Not a great place if you can't take kids screaming all over the place.

This place is awesome!!!We visit here frequently!!!The Keep It Simple burger is really good if you are looking for something that is just fresh and not saucy!! When you go ask for Sterling or Rose!!!They are the best servers and will be more than happy to have you as a customer!!!

We come here fairly often.  We have a rewards card, which means a free burger on your birthday.  We shared an order of soft pretzel bites, which were served with beer cheese dip and honey mustard.  He had the Royal Red Robin, which is topped with a fried egg.  I had the Banzai, which has teriyaki and a slice of pineapple (not as good as the Hawaiian at Volcanos in Oceanside but still tasty).   I had the wonderful steak fries and he had French onion soup. Food was great, service adequate. And the complimentary sundae for the "birthday boy" was a nice touch.

Having spent about half of my childhood in California, I'd been to Red Robin quite a few times as a kid. There was one inside the mall in our town. I remember my mom taking me there for dinner to make up for dragging me from store to store for hours on end in search of "a bra that fits" (her, not me), which according to my mom was as difficult as finding a spacious reasonably-priced apartment on 5th Avenue.  What better way to placate a whiney exhausted (and traumatized) kid than with burgers and fries and strawberry lemonade?  Fast forward 15 years, and I'm sitting in an emtpy movie theater on the 4th of July with a friend late in the evening. We decide to give RR a go, so I check the website to make sure they're open and see that they close at midnight, giving us a good 2 hours to enjoy our meal. We get there and are greeted by 3 teenaged girls who spend 2 minutes staring at a seating chart trying to figure out where to seat us despite the fact that the place is almost completely empty. Finally, one of the girls brings us to this tiny 2 person table, despite the fact that all of the big comfy-looking booths are completely unoccupied. We ask to move to a booth and she agrees but then tries to put us in the booth directly behind the only other table with customers, who shoot us evil looks for invading their space. We ask if we can sit at one of the other 75 empty booths and she reluctantly agrees, and brings us to a booth where one of her coworkers is literally sprawled out on the seat "chillin' like a villain". The chick on her break gives a big dramatic sigh and slides out of the booth so we can sit, making us feel like dicks, even though we would have been happy to sit at any of the other booths. We start looking at the menu and the genius comes back and tries to seat another party at the booth right behind us, until they ask to sit at the next booth so we're not on top of each other. The girl clearly had no clue. While we decide what to eat, we notice that there are a TON of people working at the restaurant. Well, not working, actually; more like standing around in small groups or sitting at empty tables socializing. Weird.  Our waitress, Jackie, came and took our drink and appetizer orders and gave us more time to figure out what burgers we wanted. She was back in a flash with our drinks and patiently answered my friend's 5000 questions about the food and took down his precise instructions regarding his burger. What is it with Long Islanders and food, by the way? I've never met people who are so crazy about how they like their food prepared (fries WELL DONE, extra mayo, one piece of lettuce, pickles on the side, bun untoasted). She was very sweet and rushed off to place the order. I decided to use the restroom to wash my hands before eating. There were a group of employees standing in the aisle that led to the bathroom; they were chatting as if the restaurant were closed and were oblivious of me standing there. I had to say excuse me three times before they (barely) made room for me to pass without skipping a beat in their conversation. On my way back to the table, I almost fell and broke my ass on the ramp from the bathroom to the dining area because the floor was insanely slippery. The chatting employees sawme slip and almost fall, looked up to stare at me briefly and then resumed their conversation without saying a word, and again barely made room for me to walk by them. Don't you love it when you're made to feel that your presence is a nuisance at a restaurant? Back at the table, we sit waiting for our food and notice that Jackie is working her butt off cleaning tables, dusting lamps, and even getting on her knees to clean under the tables. She stops every few minutes to check on us and reassures us that our apps will be out soon. Eventually, after 20 mins she apologizes for the delay and goes to check on the order. 5 minutes later, we get our apps and our entrees simultaneously. Being that the place was staffed up the wazoo and practically empty, the wait time was unreasonable for some mozerella sticks, two burgers and fries. Jackie was clearly embarrased and apologized profusely before going back to working like Cinderella while her ugly stepsisters... uhm coworkers continued to socialize loudly throughout the restaurant without really doing anything productive as far as we could tell. We felt bad for poor Jackie.  As for the food, the apps were fine, nothing special. My blue cheese burger was delicious and huge. My friend didn't really like his burger, but I think that has more to do with him ordering the most plain burger on the menu and then making it even more boring with all his silly adjustments than anything else. The fries were good so we got a refill from Jackie. Then we paid and left Jackie a nice tip because she was great, but agreed that we probably wouldn't go back as even the best burger's not worth a 30 min wait and employees who act like you're interrupting their party.

Very crowded on the weekends! I would suggest calling ahead and asking how long the wait for a table is. The bottomless drinks and steak fries are a nice addition to a good variety of burgers! Expect a typical Fridays/Applebee's atmosphere. However, some of the smaller tables seemed very cramped together. The service was what I expected; it was good, but nothing extraordinary. Overall a good experience!

I have to say not much negative to say about RR clean facilities, friendly prompt service. They kept it together while being short staffed that evening. Bottomless fries are a great perk  and they are cooked properly. My only gripe would be the burgers are a bit on the small side though that may just be a problem I have since I like hearty big portions. Definitely would visit again

Worst guest service. We walked in asking for a table for 4 and the host told us it was going to be a 20 min wait. We looked around and saw multiple empty tables that would have accommodated our party. After we turn around to leave another host tells us to just wait 5 mins. After siting us, it took the waitress 15 minutes to come to take our drink and food order. Service is definitively horrendous here! It took them over an hour to get us our food!!!! At least give us fries first. It's bottomless as they said. During our hour wait, we saw the tables around were also waiting long for their food. On top of starvation, a table that sat down 15 minutes before we did, received their food before us. This place is so poorly managed. We are never going here again!!! Poor establishment. Seeing all the other reviews, we weren't the only ones that experienced the same. Don't go here if u are hungry!

Not impressed. The server, although very nice, was not very attentive. No silverware, and it took forever to flag someone down to get some. More importantly, the burger was just - blah. I ordered the mushroom burger, and the mushrooms looked and tasted like they were slopped on the burger straight out of a can. The fries were missing something - if that's even possible. Skip this place and head to Five Guys.

I agree with what other have said about the service. it was horrible. The host was not friendly at all when seating us, the waiter took forever to take our order and when they brought us our food it was overcook and missing some of the things we had asked for. Also they gave us no napkins or sliver ware we had to take napkins from the table next to us until our waiter came back and we could ask him for some of our own. The food was just ok. The mushroom burger had only a few mushrooms and there seemed to be a cheese sauce on the burgers rather than real cheese. We asked for our burgers medium rare and they were well done. My wife and I agreed Burger King would have been much better. Stay away from Red Robin!
omg. super slow service. the baby chicks have already died from hunger in the nest, Momma Robin. so sad. so sad.

I would rate this a 2.5. We waited at least 20 minutes just to order and waited even more for our food which was alright, nothing special. But we were one short of a  burger, making us wait even longer. I lost my appetite by then. Later, we tried to return the check back to leave, but no one took a single look at us. And so we left. $70 down the drain.

This is a painful update because I truly LOVE Red Robin.  The past three times I have been here the service has been horrible. Appetizers arriving with the entrees, orders filled wrong and twice having to request utensils. The most recent time we were told that they did not have any clean utensils and that we had to wait for them. Mind you, we were already served our meals.  I waited three additional visits before downgrading my rating in hopes that I just visited on a bad day. Sadly, that was not the case.

I've been here a few times since they opened- it's my hubby's favorite place! He orders the same thing every time- bruschetta chicken sandwich.  I've had it- pretty delicious.  This time around I had the mushroom swiss burger, on an onion bun with an onion ring on top annnnnd bottomless sweet potato fries!!  Winner winner!! The freckled lemonade- also bottomless is a must have!!  The waiter was sooooo cheerful and soooo attentive! Love this place!!  It's pretty amazing for a chain restaurant!

Yet another quasi-fast food franchise has landed on the island. So what do I think of Red Robin after seeing ads for it for the past 5 years? Eh. I won't say it was bad,  because it wasn't.   The burgers are surely delicious,  and I like that they are almost infinitely customizable.   Also,  the fries are fresh, hot, and massively delicious. The problem is that there was nothing that stood out as being any better than any of the OTHER 50 or so quasi fast food places on Long Island.    The burgers at Ruby Tuesday or Houlihan's are just as good,  and I don't have to wait 45 minutes to eat there.  Nor do I have to be seated LITERALLY within 5 inches of another patron, squeezed into the high top tables near the bar because they are trying to cram in as many people as possible. Also, not a fan of the burger in the basket thing.   What?  You can't offer me a plate? Not terribly impressed.

I really don't like this location.  I've been to multiple locations, and this one is the worst.  I've been here twice, and both times we had the same waiter.  Not sure of the waiter's name, but he is not friendly at all.  The first time we ate here, It took him forever to come to our table and get our order.  Once we had our order, I asked for extra napkins, because we did'nt have any, and he said he would be right back.  He was gone for a while, and when he finally came back on the floor, he was finding busy work, and visiting other tables. I  tried getting his attention, but he was'nt seeing me.  Finally, I just got up and got napkins myself at the bar.  The second time we visited, we ordered the artichoke spinach dip as an appatizer.  The dip was boring with not alot of flavor, and the celery that came on the side was brown in color, warm to the touch, and dirty looking.  Ick!  Our waiter again, took forever to come to our table to see if there was anything we needed. What seemed to be a higher end manager came into the restarant and was standing right behind our table, and was yelling into the kitchen at the female employees, saying innapropriate things.  It was very akward, and not professional at all.  We paid the check and just left, we will not be returning to this location.
Pretzel Bites good for 16 month old's!! He loves them!!  Burger were delicious, service great!!  No complaints here!!

Typical chain restaurant food to go along with typical chain restaurant service.  My burger and fries were good, but like many other reviewers have noted, it was nothing special.  Not sure if I would be able to differentiate between a Red Robin burger and a burger from Applebee's or Chili's.  However, I must say that the burger selection is very creative and the seasoning for the fries is actually pretty good.   The thing that really sinks this place is the service.  It is abundantly clear that the waitstaff and hostesses don't really care about anything that happens here.  Our hostess sped right by us while mumbling something incoherently at a rapid fire pace.  Never once did she make eye contact with us.  Our waitress was nice enough, but as she flashed a disgustingly fake smile at us, it became apparent that our personal satisfaction with the meal was not very important to her.  To top it all off, we waited over 30 minutes for our food to arrive at our table.  What's that all about? Red Robin is your typical chain restaurant.  Typical chain food and typical chain service.

Review is based on take out. This place is just outside the area that we can order food from for lunch at work and get back in time without getting into trouble for being late. While it's not on the menu we kindly refer to it, as the "defiance burger". It kinda translates into "we are going to get yelled at for going,  we might as well enjoy it".  Very few things take the edge off an ass kicking then a full stomach. :) Did the vegan boca version of the whiskey river burger for lunch. It was pretty good.

"just okay"  My party and I were seated within minutes of announcing the number of diners to a table right before the doors to the kitchen.  The walls of the entire restaurant  were filled with seemingly random canvases of American pop art and American advertisements and comics from the 40's to 50's.  It must have been a fairly slow night as the atmosphere made me think that more lively conversations should be taking place among the diners at the table.   The burgers were pretty big and had interesting flavorings. However that was about it. I really wish I had gotten some appetizers because the fries were just bland and salty.   Just a tip: the special seasoning they bring is essentially salt.  Sure there are other seasonings in there but the salt pretty much overrides any other flavor. I would return only if I had a party of 6+ friends that enjoyed American food.

I am a big fan of chain restaurants  The service here was really good. However, the food was so bad. My french onion was very, very salty, I only had half as I couldn't finish it. My burger was underwhelming, filled with toppings to had the thin small hamburger that had no flavor at all. The fries were ok, if you like eating 8 fries and nothing else. In all, I would rather go to a IHOP or Friendly's over this place, which is actually cheaper and allot better.

I got a mushroom burger on 09-12-2012 visit.  Bobby Flays burger and his fries are so much better and almost the same price. I prefer Flays, chilli, applebee, Fridays, and ruby Tuesday's burger over Red Robin. That being said, the Wine is priced very reasonably.

If i could revoke stars I would. It seriously gets worse and worse with every visit. Today,  a coworker and i intended on grabbing lunch here. After ordering and waiting for 45 minutes, we decided to get up and leave. Honestly? WTF is wrong with your process? It's slow and broken and needs serious retooling. You can't compete with any of the other nearby restaurants with lunch service like this. I'm never coming back, and I'm going to write a letter to corporate to tell them how badly this franchise is performing after only a few months of being in operation. I'm seriously disappointed.

I've been to Red Robin a couple of times now. Last time I went for my free birthday burger, which I got for signing up for the Royalty Card. I have been to two different locations so far, twice in each place with different servers each time, and each time the service was friendly and excellent. They were attentive without hovering. The burgers are delicious and huge (I take half home). One of my pet peeves is having to pay extra for healthy choices. Here you get a choice of either unlimited french fries, unlimited vegetables, or other sides (I think the unlimited fruit is 50 cents more--not a  big deal).
Variety. Customer service. Atmosphere. A pretty good burger place.

I like burgers.  I like them a lot.  I eat them so often that I may turn into a cow one day.  I feel like I know what a good burger tastes like.  Red Robin knows how to make a GOOD burger.  I liked that the meat to bun to condiment ratio was perfectly proportional.  I personally don't enjoy having to dislocate my jaw to eat a ridiculously sized patty.  The guacamole bacon burger that I got was the optimal size.  I can't get over that meat to bun to condiment ratio thing.  PERFECTION.  The burger was juicy, flavorful and let's not forget about the BOTTOMLESS STEAK FRIES.  The fries were DELICIOUS.  They were not salted so you can decide how salty you like your fries.  I personally don't like any salt on them at all so this was, again, PERFECTION.  My friend got the crispy chicken burger and she really enjoyed it.  We enjoyed our meal so much that we barely spoke throughout the entire time (too busy stuffing our faces) and if you had ever met us you'd know that that's a real accomplishment.  Enough about the perfectly proportional food.  Let's talk about the service.  There were a LOT of people when we went.  We waited about 20-30 minutes which was fine because they had free balloons that we could play with.  I liked the balloons. Once we were seated our waitress came by in about 5 mins to take our drink orders.  Even though the place was really busy she made an effort to show that she was paying attention to us.  She was clearly harried but she made herself available while, simultaneously, addressing the concerns of the grumpy old couple to our left and the complaints of the woman with a baby who had spilled apple juice everywhere to our right.   In conclusion, very nice staff.  Very proportional food.  Very red balloons.  That's a recipe for success.

Another out of state favorite finally comes to Long Island. This place gets a lot right.  The service is wonderful, a great place for families. The burgers are good, and the topping options make them great! Mushrooms, Ranch sauce, Avocado, Jalapeno coins, and of course Pineapple are just some of the options on the menu.   Add in Bottomless fries, free refills, shakes, towering apps, interesting side options and you got one of the best all around burger experiences on Long Island This place will add inches to my waste-line this summer.

After seeing the "meh" reviews on here, I was a little nervous about trying Red Robin.  I am happy I did try it though!  My boyfriend and I came here early Friday night and were seated right away.  The waiter was very young, but friendly.  We started with a half appetizer of teriyaki chicken wings and yukon fries.  The wings were okay, nothing too special there.  I ordered the gourmet cheeseburger and the burger was exactly my kind of burger.  Big, juicy, cooked exactly the way I ordered and piled with red onions...yum!  Boyfriend got one of the fancier burgers, he thought it was good, but said he would probably get a burger like mine next time.  I saw some of the other yelp reviews complaining about the restaurant and bathrooms being dirty.  I didn't observe that at all.  Also, I got some kind of Red Robin card, I think you get the 10th burger free or something like that.  I would definitely go back!

The food is OK, service left something to be desired. I'll explain. So I went there on a weeknight after 7pm. I expected it to be busy but it was packed. They told me 45 minutes (seriously!) and I started to wait. 5 minutes later the buzzer went off.   OK. No complaints there. They sat me at a table for 2 with my friend. It was one of those tables where one side of the table sits on a bench like seat while the other has a chair. That is one of my biggest pet peeve at restaurants because you have zero privacy.  I really don't want to share my entire conversation with the tables to the left and right.  I'll tolerate this at Vincents but that's about it. Anyway we order our drinks first. Mine (alcohol) took about 10 minutes (which was pretty long too) but my poor friend had to wait until AFTER our meal came for a root beer float. Didn't know it was so complicated.  2nd waitress appears explaining that the 1st one was covering for her when she was on a break. All of a sudden our meal comes out..but wait, what about the appetizer?  "Oh sorry..maybe it's waiting there?"  Me - never mind Them - NO..WE'LL GET IT! (Running away so I couldn't tell them again to forget it)  So my main course (Burger) and Appetizer (Mozz sticks) were on the table at the same time.  Since there was zero privacy, 10 minutes later I heard the same exact thing happen to the table next to us as well.   Like I said food was OK so I'll probably give them another shot hoping that was a one time thing.

I ate here almost 3 weeks ago, and it took me up until now to get over the horrible experience. The hype was crazy but we went late at night so the wait wasn't too long.  The staff was friendly and informative.  The fries can be seasoned So what's the problem? The burgers. I'd give it 2 stars but the rewards system is pretty good.

If you have all day to wait around for a mediocre burger, this is the place for you. The service is so slow, it's unreal. They tout bottomless fries but good luck getting your server's attention to actually bring you more.

Party of 3: Appetizers, Drinks and Entrees each. The worst service I've received in a long while!  In fact, when I'm out with kids - I would rather drive another 2 or 3 miles to go to Friendly's. Why? This time I was out with the folks instead of kids. Ma ordered 2 appetizers for the table, both Mom & Dad ordered Root Beer Floats. While the waitress took our order for Entrees I ordered a Beer from their Happy Hour menu.  Had a whole conversation with the waitress about the special and asked: "Is Guinness part of the your draft beers?" (Exact words - I kid you not!) Reply: Yes. Mom & Dad's root beer floats took a good 20 minutes to come. Yea, we waited a good 10 mins. before the waitress came to take our food order and then another good 10 mins. went by before the Floats came. Another 5 minutes later the appetizers came. We ordered the Fried Zucchini and Fried Mushrooms. We got ONE mushroom each! Zucchini was actually delicious - so that is where they get the one star from. Another 10 minutes pass and we get our burgers. Dad liked his Banzai Burger a lot! I ordered the American, which was ok and Mom got the Mushroom and she said the same thing "ok." At this point still no Guinness. So, Mom tried flagging down our waitress and at this point we got it - she was ignoring us completely! I said loudly: "Don't worry about it, I don't get my beer we don't pay for it!" At the very end of our meal - guess what? My beer finally came! A few minutes later we had to flag down our waitress again for the check. We found out she overcharged us for the beer because Happy Hour is only in the Bar. Would have been nice if SOMEONE said so before they decided to FINALLY send the beer over. Mom knew I was PISSED OFF so she just paid everything in full. She was nice enough to leave a $7 tip and I said to only leave $5. Should I have gotten a hold of the manager it would not have been pretty. If you go to NCC, Hofstra, or Adelphi don't drink here!!! The Guinness was skunk anyway! If you're hungry, don't eat here. It'll be a long wait. If you have kids - ok, eat here. Kids are not often hard to please.
Waiter was great food was good, didn't wait long at all. I loved the drink I had the T.N.T. Really tasty yumm. The place was we'll kept too. Although I do wish there menu selection was more broad.
I actually was surprised, very good burger joint with great drink specials. I will return for sure!

Waited 45 minutes food never came, they kept giving us complimentary baskets of fries, but there were only a handful in each basket. Manager came and said food will be right out.. Waited another twenty minutes. The couple next to us had issues to, cold food. What happened to this place? Sorry, you lost a loyal customer.

As a vegetarian, I love their veggie burger. That spicy southwest sauce is so good. They actually changed their veggie burger briefly and it didn't have that sauce. I'm really glad they changed it back. They also make great (endless) fries. They have great drink specials and the normal prices are good too. Price is decent for the food as well. Service is hit and miss. I've had a few excellent servers and some not so good, such is the nature of large chain restaurant service. If you come on the weekend or around dinner time you can expect a bit of a wait if you're coming with more than one person. I've had instances where the wait time was 45 minutes, I just went to Barnes and Noble to kill the time. There's always a workaround if you're not lazy. I first went to a Red Robin in Pennsylvania and was dying to have it again. I'm really glad one opened up in Nassau County.
Stopped off here with Heather since it was next to Guitar Center and it was lunch time.  Two very good burgers later.............:-)

Gets pretty packed on the weekends so prepare for a wait if you're dining with three or more people.  As another burger restaurant chain, there's not much to be blown away by but the selection is still great.  The jalapeño chips are pretty good too (not for the faint of heart!)

Was there this past Sunday. Service is really poor. Waitress was trying, but she had too many tables. Paid extra for bacon dip but got a cup with half a teaspoon. By the time we got more, we were done eating. (30 minutes). Took half an hour for more fries, as well. Daughter asked for no tomatoes, but they were on burger. I asked for no sauce on my burger. I HAD sauce, daughter DIDN'T. Just a lack of attention to detail by the kitchen. When multiple things are wrong, and you have to wait so long, it disappoints the customer. People next to us left because they waited too long for there food. Manager should take note.

Red Robin yuuuuum!  I finally tried this spot out with my friend! Okay so parking was plentiful, decor is cool on par with this level chain restaurant. I enjoyed the guacamole burger with fries which were just meh.  Fries are unlimited which they joyfully refill one small basket at a time. But for $25, lunch for two not bad at all.

Ok so there was ONE person who told me that Five Guys was NOT the best chain burger they've ever eaten and they told me Red Robin was so I had to check this place out.  Upon entering Red Robin I had wait for a seat. My first thought: "Am I here for a burger or a 5 course meal?"  Ok so my friend and I were seated after a few minutes, and then a few more minutes later our waitress came to our table only to mutter "I'll be right with you." All I wanted was a damn burger, and it was too much trouble already.  Finally when the Burger came I was pleased. I ordered their signature "Red Robin Burger"  The bun was fresh, the meat was tender and evenly cooked although the meat patty itself lacked seasoning and was bland and too me that was a big downer.  The burger was less greasy and oily than Five Guys, and the whole presentation of the burger in itself was great, but the quality of the meat I have to say Five Guys tastes better.  Here is an analogy:  -Five Guys is like high performance sports car that might lack air conditioning, comfortable seats or even sound dampening material for weight reduction. This high performance sports car runs loud and the right is stiff and uncomfortable, BUT the car is there to serve one purpose: GO FAST.  -Red Robin in the luxury sedan. Its good for the family, its safe, it has comfort features like heated seats, quiet interior, etc. BUT its is SLOW.  In short, Red Robin has an great look and feel. The presentation of the food is good, the restaurant is nicely decorated, and their whole "gourmet" them is played though very well. What they lack is the meat and potatoes (pardon the pun) of a GREAT tasting burger spot. I give them a B+

The service at this place seems to get worse the longer it stays open. How that is possible, I have no idea. Entered the other day, a weekday, at 2PM- it was not crowded by any stretch of the  imagination.  Took nearly 10 minutes to be seated.  Why? Once we were seated we waited for  at least 7 minutes for a waiter before we said eff this and left.  There's no shortage of restaurants within walking distance in the country glen center- who do they think they are?
ranch dressing & fries are good burgers are really good, and there new burgers are particularly delicious

Wow, Red Robin.  After my previous amazing experience, when I was in town and everyone in my party still hadn't tried it, we decided this would be where we'd go!  We gave a very pleasant waitress our name and when we asked how long the wait would be, we changed our mind.  The waitress changed too...her demeanor!  Needless to say, we left Red Robin with a very bad taste in our mouths. In this tough economy where social media and word of mouth rule, businesses would be smart to train their staff on how to interact with customers--especially those first in the line of engagement. Next time we're in the area and we're looking for a place to eat, I don't think Red Robin will be on our list.

Peter Lugers it aint!  But it's kid friendly and their prices are reasonable.  Being that I went in between lunch and dinner (about 4:30 pm), it was empty.  We were seated immediately, service was very friendly and fast.  Decent burgers and chicken sandwiches, but nothing special.

Been here a few times as well as at other locations nationwide. This is my favorite location. The staff is always been very helpful especially when it comes to my wife's celiac disease. They all have been quite knowledgeable with her allergy and have made very helpful suggestions.  Kudos to the Red Robin mgmt for the training and having such a great staff. Favorite all around is the Royal Red Robin on an UDI's bun or lettuce leaf wrap. Just keep doing what your doing guys!!

This place isn't that great. I do enjoy the fact that they have bottomless apps. I had a burger and it tasted as if I made it. The Shorty was pretty good. The sauce they gave for it was also good although I don't know what it was and I forgot to ask. The only reason I'm giving this a 2 star is because of the service. The waitress my group had was very nice and upbeat. They need more people like her.

Food and service are great.....not a long wait for a table staff are very friendly.  Management is always walking around checking on you and making sure your food is what you ordered.  Even if ur waiter is busy they are there to get you what you need! Place is great

I was pleasantly surprised they have many choices for burgers - beef, chicken, veggie and lots of toppings and even different buns to choose from. Plus u don't have to get fries with that. It's neat that they are so flexible.

This is a good burger not great but it is a good deal.   I ordered a BBQ mushroom burger that had a fancy name.   It came with fries and I ordered a soda. The bill without tip was about 10-11 dollars and the fries are unlimited.  So compared with a Big Mac or a Whopper meal that costs about 8-9 dollars or Five Guys that costs about 9-10 dollars Red Robin is a few dollars more but it comes with more food and better atmosphere. The service and overall operations needs improvement.  Maybe in some smaller less populated and less demanding area like NJ or PA it would be OK but this is NY and they need to step up there game.

When I found out a Red Robin was being built relatively close by I was kind of excited.  I'd heard so much about them and those YUMMMMMMMMMM commercials kind of fed the excitement.   Having been there twice, my take on it is REEEEEEED ROBIN... Meh. Don't get me wrong, the place isn't terrible.  The burgers weren't bad, and they have a good number of choices, but it just wasn't all that fantastic.  Its not really their fault.  Its a chain, and like all chains, the food isn't exactly all that memorable.  (The french onion soup from TGIF being an exception, but mostly because that was like licking a salt wheel for a hamster) The burgers are large and juicy, but I don't recall them having an OMG quality.  For example, I'll remember the burgers I've gotten from The Spotted Pig and Burger Joint, but this one was instantly forgettable.  I remember there was stuff on it.  OK, there's lots of choices for stuff, but again, kinda forgettable.  The standouts are actually the chicken sandwiches - mostly because they do a very good job of making chicken breast not only edible, but tasty.  You have to understand my perspective - I find restaurant chicken breast to be dry, flavorless, and generally unpleasant.  Red Robin's chicken was pretty tasty.  I'd recommend chicken sandwiches and wraps over their burgers BY FAR. Red Robin offers unlimited fries, which is great for the people that love their fries.  If you're a fan of thick fries that taste like dry mashed potatoes with a skin then sure, go nuts.  I like thin & crispy fries.  That's not what you get, so this does absolutely nothing for me.  The last time I was there the fries were MUSHY and lukewarm.  There are a number of other sides and appetizers as well, though we only tried the jalapeno coins and fried clams.  The clams are tasty, but the coins are hit and miss.  The first time I tried them I loved them.  The second time they were crazy hot (spicy) and nearly inedible.   Good luck getting silverware.  On both occasions we had to ask different servers several times for a set, and it took a long time to get them.  I know these things are considered finger food, but FFS, its not too much to ask for a fork by default, is it? Like all chain restaurants in this area, prepare for a wait of epic proportions on the weekend.  Don't even bother trying to wait at the bar since there's going to be a wait for a place to wait at the bar. If you're curious about the place, sure, go on, enjoy yourself.  If you're in the area and want a decent burger, drive a little further to 5 Guys.

Okay, so in reading the other reviews, I'm starting to see a pattern here not unlike my two visits.  The food is four-star quality and the service is three, at best.  The only thing saving it from a two-star is the fact that they comped almost the whole ticket on our last visit. Just to recap... We go there on a Saturday night around 730pm.  We expect it to be busy and it is.  We wait about 20 minutes to be seated (shorter than the half-hour they predict).  We're go so far... We sit down and order our drinks: two root beer floats and a glass of water.  This is where things get dicey.  First, the water comes to the table with apologies that the bartender is having "a hard time" making our floats.  When they do finally show up, they're literally half-full.  I'm thinking to myself "thank god they're bottomless" and we have a laugh about it.  Then, the waiter takes our food order.  He's a nice enough guy but he kind of has that thousand-yard stare of a soldier who's been to hell and back...and apparently, if you work at Red Robin in Carle Place, you have. He sees we finished our floats so he informs us he already put in for two new ones because he noticed they were half-full.  Good thing, because it took another fifteen minutes to get them and when he puts them half-full on the table, we all start laughing.  He apologizes again for the bartender being a loaf and also puts down a full pint glass of root beer to pour into our floats as we sip away at them. Now we wait for the food. The waiter comes back after about a half-hour and tells us our food is late, thus overstating the obvious. He tells us he's going to check on it and comes back with three burgers.  Just not ours.  As it turns out, the kitchen screwed all three of them up.  Again, apologies ensue, as well as laughter when he's leaves the table.  He returns shortly thereafter and tells us the manager will be dropping our burgers off shortly and apologizes yet again. Ten minutes later, the manager shows up with two burgers for three people.  When he sees three hungry people sitting there, he tells us "oh, I guess there's supposed to be a third".  Again, apologies and laughter commence. After the elusive third burger shows it's face, we dig in to what are seriously some damn good burgers.  We had two prime chophouse burgers and a royal red robin.  My chophouse burger was unevenly cooked, but it still tasted really good.  The sweet potato fries (ordered well-done) were crisp and fresh.  The steak fries on the other two burgers were really good as well.   The big surprise here was the mac and cheese.  I ordered it almost as a goof because I've never had it from any restaurant that was any good but their mac and cheese was fantastic.  It was cheesy and buttery and the macaroni was perfectly cooked. See?  The food is great.  You just have to wait for it. The manager comped our burgers. We still paid for the half-floats, but I could live with that. We also tipped like we paid for a full meal.  There's no reason the waiter had to suffer for the kitchen's and bartender's incompetence.  The guy worked his butt off.  People should remember that when you get a comped ticket.  If it's not the wait staff's fault, don't take it out on them.   All in all, I will go back with the hope that they will get their act straight.  If not, i can at least hope for a free three-hour meal.

So i came here back when they opened and the food was grear. But as time passed the quality just went down the drain and the service started to lag. The burgers seem to always come out luke warm. The only thing that comes out at a decent temperature is the french fries. After about coming here off and on flr two years i decided to stop. And then i returned in december 2014 with hopes it got bettwr.  But alas i was wrong. I ordered the bleu ribbon burger which was way too salty. It took close to 27 minutes to get our food and that was just the appetizer. The burgwr came 15 minutes after that. The burger was again luke warn. And the bread was pretty much on its last hours and tasted stale. I just cant come back here. It lost its luster for me.

My soup the french onion's base I think was the dip juice from another option for dinner, sooooo salty. My grilled chicken sandwich's bun was soggy. Been here a few times but this not not good at all.

Do not go to this Red Robin location! The female general manager is in the kitchen not wearing a hairnet or a hat with extremely long greasy hair!! Straws are also not individually wrapped and are touched by the servers bare hands!!!

When I walked in I was surprised how empty the place was... When I left, I was not.  Slow service, they gave us the wrong burgers, the bathrooms were disgusting and the waitress had bad breath.   They comped 2 of the screwed up meals but it did not make up for the disappointing experience.  Too bad.

I may have already reviewed this place when it first opened, and I think I rated it fairly high. I've been back MANY, MANY times since then, and I gotta say that I do agree that it's gone WAAAAY downhill. And that sucks because this is the only Red Robin in this area. I love the food and the shakes. The prices are fair. But the service is terrible! Terrible means waiting 30 minutes before the server even comes by to take drink orders. It means having your order screwed up in more ways than one. It means trying to flag down someone ANY ONE to get a refill, that is IF the bartender FEELS like making mixed drinks. We were told one night that the bartender was DONE making "complex" drinks and we needed to limit our drink orders to something they can pull out of a tap. We came at 11pm once (they close at midnight) and the kitchen decided they weren't going to bread the mushroom I ordered as an app because they didn't feel like it. When the food does come out right, it's hard to enjoy it because 9 times out of 10, they FORGET to put utensils and napkins on the table.  How does a franchise fail on every single aspect of customer service??? Where is the manager? Where is the service checks to make sure your staff is performing well? A bartender who doesn't know what beer they carry or refuses to make drinks? A kitchen staff that can't read a ticket and skips protocol on food prep? And servers who are either too busy or don't have enough experience on how to wait on multiple tables? I don't get it. I LOVED my Red Robin dinners with my buddies, but coming out aggravated after another bad dining experience with them isn't worth ruining a Friday or Sat night.  With so many other dining options in the area, this one is now easily skipped.

"Gourmet"?  Seriously?  Your cooking choices are a touch of pink or well.  Even the touch of pink that I ordered came out well done.  Server claimed they can only cook them a "touch of pink" or "well" because that is the only way "they" will allow it.  I assume "they" are corporate.  If the ground beef is that cheap and risky, how can you call it gourmet?  Service was less than average.   The diner across the street has better service and much better burgers!  And you can get one cooked the way you want it!

Nice,casual place...Burgers are pretty good, although I prefer their California chicken sandwich.  The reason I'm not giving them 5 stats is because out of, at least 10 times that I've been there, a few the food was brought just hardly warm, so every time we go there, we have to tell the waitress to bring us food while it's hot. The desserts are really good, especially the Mud pie, although they cut the portion size. One thing i don't like is that if you want to substitute french fries for something else, they really overcharge you, unless it's a little salad of small dish of rotten fruit. If you want something else, like sweet potato fries, it's like $3 extra. Stupid, in my opinion. The refillable lemonades are really good... Overall, it nice and I will continue going there.  PS: Sign up for their rewards card if you're going to be going there often. I got a free burger for my birthday, every 10 burgers, you get one free, and they send you little perks via email.

I really liked this place the first time I went here, but each time I came back, it was progressively more disappointing. It's kind of difficult to find parking because this restaurant shares a private lot with a lot of busy stores in this little shopping pavilion. You should also be prepared to wait if you come at a popular lunch or dinner time and a lot of people bring their children here so it can get kind of hectic with all the little rugrats dashing wildly around your legs as you wait in the cramped little waiting area. The burgers are cheap and I believe you get infinite fries as long as you keep asking for them but I wouldn't see why you would because their fries are VERY mediocre and the only real reason to eat them is to mindlessly stuff your face hole full of food. I really like their Burnin' Love burger because I'm a big fan of jalapenos. If you're looking for an easy and cheap burger joint, then this place serves that purpose satisfactorily.  This is the only Red Robin on Long Island so they've got that exclusivity going for them. Just don't come here and expect a miracle.
This place was very good. I had  The Southern Charm Burger™which was  excellent. The Red's Bold Boneless Wings are delicious.  The fries are very good also. The waiter was nice and friendly.

I'm always satisfied with the flavor and size of my meals.  Service is very good.  Their servers really know their menu.   The waiting was 15 but we where happy to be seated after just 3 minutes waiting.

It was my first time eating at the restaurant.  Service was slow once we were seated. The gourmet burgers were small and didn't taste great. The best part of the meal were the bottomless fries. They were well seasoned. The waitress was nice but disappeared too often.  I felt like I was in there forever.

After a 15 minute wait to get in and a 20 minute wait at the table we got our food.  It's a good burger (good, not great).  Nothing special about the burger but you can get some fun tasty toppings.   I had avocado, bacon and cheese.   This made for a nice tasty burger with steak fries...  Nice wait staff but they are always contending with large parties and screaming babies..

As fun as this place can be from time to time, it seriously lacks consistency.  Specifically, in the service.  Once, my boyfriend and I went there to grab lunch and we waited at our table for 15 minutes and our server never came to greet us or get a drink.  We had to leave and go to Chipotle because we were on a lunch break.   The burgers are fun to get and are pretty good, that is if your server ever arrives to ask if you'd like to order one!

Pretty disappointed when my son goes out for a birthday dinner with his girlfriend and her mom, only to get a panicked text that he might have salmonella!! He was served a practically raw chicken. When the manager came over he took it off the bill and offered dessert?!?! How about... I'll be sending you the doctor bill when my son is ill!!! What a disgrace! It's chicken people... It needs to cook all the way! There's no med, med rare or well done option!!!! Will never recommend this poor excuse for a family  burger place!!!

Very great place. They should clean the floor before they seated people. But all together the food was good. Nice soft mouth watering buns and the french fries were quite phenomenal. Alot of different sauces ! However the wait for the food was very long.

I've been here a few times now and it's never disappointed. The burgers taste really good and I do enjoy their apps. Honestly what I enjoy most about this place is their bottomless fries, it's a practice I wish more places had. It's also the only place I know of that has free refills on floats, which normally at other restaurants you have to pay for.

We sat down and nobody even noticed us for 10 minutes. Not even forks and knives have been places. People around us got that stuff. It's saturday around 1pm. Place in not crowded at all. Let's hope the food is good. It seemed as they were jsut haveing a ruff day and all was getting better. I had the Bacon buger. It was ok. My son had the kids mac and cheese. It looked ok but you know kids he never touched it. I would return for a burger but I wold go to the dinner first

Waited approximately five minutes just for my name to be put on the list to be seated. Then took about twenty for my party and about four  others to get seated meanwhile there were about five tables waiting to be cleaned off.  My boyfriend ordered  Jim beam of  the rocks and it was 95% ice.  My Cocorita is supposed to be a margarita and pina Colada in one. It was nothing more than a watery virgin pina Colada.  Save your time and go to the red Robin in Lindenhurst. That one gives great service food and drinks every time without fail.

Why would anyone think this is a good burger? It's rubbery and unfortunately I could taste the poor quality beef. Dry ad a bone too. Fries are Not cooked enough. Lack crispness. Forgetabouit! WIGB? No

I ordered the guacamole bacon burger and the artichoke dip, along with a diet coke. The server brought the wrong drink. Then after a 30 minute wait, we received our appetizer and burgers simultaneously. By the time we finished the first, the burgers were already cold. We asked for a Bud Light Platinum and he said none was sold there. We then pointed out the sign advertising it, and he brought us some. The fries were mediocre. The server didn't bring us napkins, when we asked for some, he still didn't bring any.  We then went to the bar and took some ourselves. Barely any guacamole on my burger.  We got a refill of fries after waiting another 10 minutes. Overall, terrible service, mediocre food. The servers need a good kick in the pants!

After seeing the commercials for years my fiancee and i were super excited to hear one had opened up near us. The wait wasn't bad about 10 minutes, and we were able to look over the menu while we waited. Our waiter was friendly and attentive. We started with the onion ring tower it was epic and the dipping sauce were outrageous!! We also got the endless rootbeer float soo good!!! For dinner she had the bbq burger and i got the blue ribbon burger with an extra patty for only two bucks more, can't beat that!!!! My only complaint was that the burger can only be cooked to either med or well and I prefer rare but i cant wait to come back and try other items.

I heard about this national chain and I thought that it was like Chili's or Friday's. I was pleasently surprised. Cheeseburger in paradise! Great assortment of beers. The menu of sandwiches and salads looked good but we went for the classic. Better than the other chains. Juicy with sweet potato fries.  Quick and curteous service. A noisy room with lots of kids but appropriate.  The wait will be long when the word gets out. Very reasonable prices and the Robin Rewards card brings more.  We will be back!

This place is alright. There is nothing special about it. There is nothing that is spectacular on their menu . The decor is the tackiest of all the chains. The restaurant is always loud and way too family oriented for single people to have to deal with. Ive been to this restaurant 4 times and its always sub par and loaded with parents who arent paying attention to their children. This is a good place for families not so much for young adults.

I love Red Robin!!! The service always great. The servers are TOO nice. The food is great. The turkey burger is perfect. The meat is sensational and seasoned perfectly. I really enjoy the chipotle sauce. My daughter LOVES the chicken fingers!!! The service is fast. The shakes are amazing. The BEST onion rings ever are here. We love the tower.

Never coming back to this place again. The service sucks and the food takes forever to come out. We walked it at 11am and it was only 4 tables of customers at the time. We order a burger and salad, 40 min later we are still waiting. As I finally flag the waiter over to ask why is our food taking so long the food came. The chicken on my wife salad was burnt and the chili on my burger was cold. The manager came over and apologized to us for the wait, claimed there was an issue with the kitchen and said she would take 50% off the bill. I hold her it wasn't just about the wait, it was more about not being inform. 40 mins of waiting the waiter didn't even come over once to see if we were ok, but after my complaint he came over ever 2 mins to check up on us and informed us that the manager is going to takecare of the whole bill. It was nice of them to do that for us, but I would have rather paid for my food and not have wasted my time in this place. Never again will I come back.

The burger was good, but not as good as I anticipated. While the toppings offered a lot of flavors,  the burger was bland. Burgers taste as if they are precooked and are all delivered slightly pink inside. I asked twice for medium well but my burger was still too pink for my liking. The towering onion rings were so greasy, the oil seemed to drip down the side of the stack.  Unlimited fries maybe a great way to get diners, but our server never came by to replenish them or our bottomless drinks.  None of our party of 4 were particularly impressed with the food or service. The food was very salty and left us thirsty for hours afterward. This is fast food flavor at restaurant prices.  We will probably not return.

i was around the area for some quick chiptole. too bad the chiptole was close so i came to the nearest food place and it was red robin. it is a definite dine in experience but too bad i had to go. i ordered apple grilled chicken with salad and 2 servings of their endless fries. now thats what im talking about. endless fries!!! the fries wasnt that flavorful but it was sure bountiful. they steak cut fries. my salad was good but it shouldnt have taken 15 minutes to prepare. it needed a little bit more tang or sweetness for an apple salad.
I have been to much better Red Robin restaurants. This one lacks in customer service. I won't go back anymore.

I have been here twice and both time I had a great experience.  The food was great as it is at all Red Robins and the service was good as well.  I read a lot of negative reviews about the service here so maybe  was just lucky when I was there.  I hope when I go back I have the same service as I always have.

Great food, just not the same as the one we go to in Pennsylvania. In Pennsylvania when you order a monster shake they give you enough for two shakes, here they make the shake and whatever is left in the container they give you, and sometimes that is only a dribble. When we complained about it they told us that it depends on who makes it. So, we gave up paying extra for just a dribble and when we go we don't order the monster shakes anymore. Their loss. I think I would rather travel the extra 2 hours and go to the one in Pennsylvania instead, the staff is friendlier.

After Red Robin came to Long Island and my friend who used to enjoy Red Robin when he lived in Colorado, we decided to go this Red Robin when he was visiting me from Florida along with his girlfriend. Walking into Red Robin, you will find that the atmosphere is clean and cheerful, with all sorts of kitschy items like posters hanging on the wall. After we were seated, I decided to order a Banzai Burger wrapped in lettuce due to my gluten allergies with fries and a Diet Coke. Within fifteen minutes, our burgers and fries arrived and I was ready to dig in. While the burger was seasoned well and was complimented by the sweet and sour pineapple and the fresh and crisp lettuce and tomato, I found the burger to be somewhat disappointing as it was kind of dry and crumbly. The burger may have been disappointing, but the fries (which are unlimited) were thick, wide, and filled with potatoey goodness and were complimented the spicy seasoning at the table. Service from our waitress was friendly and accommodating as well. As far as the prices, they are OK, at about $9 for a burger and fries. While I would go back to this Red Robin as my friend is a huge fan of it, I prefer Bobby's Burger Palace at Roosevelt Field or Five Guys for a better burger.

My best friend & I were excited to try the Carle Place installment of Red Robin.  We had been to a location in PA and enjoyed it. I've been to a NJ RR and enjoyed the "bottomless steak fries".  Well, in short , Carle Place left me cold.  The service was really uneven.  The lighting was like a cafeteria, glaring down on you like a rotisserie chicken, I kid you not!!! lol Our server, although sweet , completely jumped ship, although she passed us no less than 6 times as we attempted eye contact for a refill of "Bottomless fries" or "bottomless beverages".  There seemed to be issues with her section, but at least 5 or so other employees were nearby that clearly could have helped our table & section out.  Finally got those refills from another server.  If they dimmed the damn lights and straightened out the service, it would no doubt be a better experience.  The food was tasty but one definitely needs a beverage to wash all that salty, albeit yummy grub down!!!!

This was a toss-up between two and three stars, but I gave it three because the burgers are actually pretty good. They aren't the best burgers out there compared to Five Guys, Shake Shack, Five Napkin etc. It's got a Applebees/TGIFridays feel too it. It can get very crowded and service can get slow. If you are looking for a good burger go elsewhere. if you are looking for a family friendly environment then this may be the place for you.
Food was good, but service was horrendous.  Waited 40 min plus for dinner and waiter did not check on us entire time.  Mouth went dry from lack of refills.

So I was excited to try this Red Robin because I used to live in Pittsburgh and I loved the one there. However, i was seriously disappointed in this Red Robin. What a horrible experience. First of all the waitress brought me water in a dirty glass. I told her and she agreed and apologized. Then my burger comes, I was horrified to find a hair in the burger. They brought me another burger that I didn't even eat because I was grossed out. Top it all off, we get the check and they only took off the price of the original burger. Never going there again.

seriously worst service ive ever recieved. no wonder the one that was here in levittown didn't last a while back. you guys don't stand a chance. the service keeps getting worse with every visit and your always out of something important. one visit you were out of cups to put sauces in and someone recieved a cone cup that your employees use for drinking as a sauce container. seriously? oh and who runs out of napkins.  never will return here again, and i suggest not going if your expecting highly.

Stopped by on the way from the mall.  I really dont get the bad reviews..  Where else can you get a huge burger and fries for $10.  i actually enjoyed it and would go back...  It's a family place though..  Be prepared for screaming kids...

What a terrible Red Robin! The place seemed kind of dirty and desolate. Worse yet, my Banzai Burger had no grilled pineapple (and that's why anyone gets the Banzai Burger, come on?!). When I told the waiter it was missing it, he asked me to lift up the bun and prove it. Really dude, come on. Are you really going to accuse me of trying to rip you off for a pineapple ring? Anyway, after I proved I had not, in fact, attempted to cheat my way into an extra pineapple ring, he brought me a raw, not grilled one, from the kitchen. I wouldn't go back.

This place is overwhelmingly mediocre and I understand that it is a chain and I am rating it as such. For a place that specializes in burgers, their burgers flat out stink. They are under seasoned, overcooked, soggy and served on a boring plain bun. There are chains, Ruby Tuesday in particular, that have way better burgers. I made the mistake of ordering clam chowder which was horrible and this is inexcusable because it most definitely comes from a frozen bag and honestly they should switch vendors. The server Joe however was very attentive and did a very good job. I will likely avoid this place in the future.

RED ROBIN ... yummm! Yeah, we've all heard it. Doesn't mean it impressed me, because it didn't. :(  The burger was huge, messy and like fellow Yelper Justin F. mentioned -- comes in a basket. Uhh, hard to eat much? It was. You do get unlimited fries, but so what? Not like I could eat that much after downing the massive burger. I don't really remember the fries being all that stellar, either.  For what it was, it didn't stand out against any other chain restaurant on Long island. For what you'll spend here, you can eat just about anywhere and get similar quality.
Nice and friendly and fast service.  Good food.  What more could you ask for?  Oh yeah, lots of veggie options!

We went a month ago. What used to be our favorite burger place... All I can say is, what happened?! Orders coming from the kitchen seem to take forever. It's like as if they're missing 1/3 of kitchen staff. Biggest disappointment, the garlic parmesan French fries which is our favorite -- used to be made with fresh diced garlic, grated parmesan, drizzled with oil with fresh diced parsley leaves sprinkled over the fries. What did we get instead? Garlic powder and parmesan powder sprinkled on fries. What the hell?! And I'm paying extra for that laziness?! Can't taste any of the parmesean, sprinkled oil, or garlic. Save your money, just stick with either the fries or onion rings. At least the burgers still taste great.

Don't know why the reviews are average. I love this place. They have a lot of burgers available with some interesting but tasty toppings. They also have some regular dishes if you're not feeling a burger. The service here is good and the environment here usually isn't too rambunctious unless there's a game going on. Definitely recommend!

Poor service begins and ends in the kitchen, not with the wait staff or manager.  Stopped in around 11:30 am on Tuesday, really craving a burger and beer and figuring l'd give Red Robin a try instead of the other burger places in the area.  The place was empty but for two or three tables.  No one was manning the front so the bartender took the initiative and led me to a high table in his area.  I was the only patron there.  Within 5 minutes I had ordered a burger and was starting into my beer.  After a while the bartender headed back to the kitchen to inquire on my burger.  Nothing.  Over the next  20-25 minutes, he went back no fewer than 4 times, apologizing to me after the third time. From my vantage point, I could see his frustration with the cook, who seemed to be making a joke over the situation.  By this point there were maybe seven tables occupied in the restaurant so there was no great pressure on the kitchen.  In any event, it should not take a half hour to get a burger in an empty burger house.   I couldn't help but wonder what was gonna happen when lunch hour was in full swing?  After his fourth visit to the kitchen, the bartender came back with a plate of fries, saying at least I'd have something to nosh on while I waited.  I had actually watched him take two plates off the kitchen counter, apparently for me, only to put one of them back at the direction of the cook.  It appeared to me that the cook was simply enjoying messing with the bartender's order.   At that point I advised the bartender that I was about ready to pay for the beer and leave.  He hustled back to the kitchen, this time with the manager.  I finished my beer and took one of the fries.  It was lukewarm.   I was done.  Rather than make a scene, I stood up, placed $5 on the bar, and asked a young woman sitting there, who appeared to be friends with the bartender, to tell him the money was for the beer and that I had left.  I walked out while the manager and the bartender were  both in the kitchen area, presumably trying to resolve the matter. In the parking lot, I was furious that I had wasted a half hour being played, and I was pissed at myself for leaving anything for the beer.  I called from the car to speak to the manager who was aware of what had happened and was extremely apologetic and gracious.  He offered to make good on it  if I would return to the restaurant, but I told him all I wanted was my $5 back on principle.  He agreed and met me outside with the $5 and the burger and fries wrapped to go, which he insisted I take as a token of his apology.  I did not get his name, but he warrants praise for handling the situation professionally.   When I got to my destination ten minutes later, the bun was soggy and the burger cold.  What a waste.  Never again.

Wow, based on reviews I'm reading I'm glad we left.  At 1:40 in the afternoon, there was a line to get to the hostess stand & loads of people.  What the heck?!?!?!  Not to mention the horrific traffic in getting to the location as well as getting a parking space in the miniature parking lot in front. I didn't even get to try the food & I've never been to Red Robin.  However, when people are hungry & need to eat at once it doesn't do your business any good to have no seating area for customers, a line to the hostess stand + expect people to wait God knows how long for your food i.e not bothering to post anything telling us about the wait time.  I'll pass.   Maybe next time you should try posting how long the wait is so folks will actually be swayed into hanging around instead of fearing they're blocking someone's path.

went here tonight on st. paddy's day with my family.  coincidentally, it was also my birthday.  we were greeted with a very attentive girl who seated us quickly.  (not much of a wait around 630pm).   After we sat down, we ordered our drinks from what we thought was the server, however he said he was there to just take the drinks and then introduced us to the waiter who would be serving us.  After taking the drink orders, a few minutes afterwards, he came back with the drinks...quite quickly! shortly afterwards, the waiter came by and took our order.  the food that we ordered was quite good and we loved the great service that was given to us.  my daughter mentioned to the waiter that it was my birthday and a few staff members stopped by to wish me a happy birthday.  was quite enjoyable.   This was the first time my wife has been here and she was pleasantly surprised.  she loved her burger and would definitely go back. The staff was amazingly attentive and Troy, the manager on staff was quite friendly and always involved with the entire restaurant.   I would definitely recommend this place and will definitely be returning in the future.  Clean dining areas attentive staff fast service food was delicious BOTTOMLESS fries! kid friendly overall, great experience for my birthday.
We had a great lunch today. Thanks to the waiter Mark for helping make great suggestions and taking great care of us. Food delicious but when the service is great the visit is all the better. Xoxo

It was A-OK!  The atmosphere was a that of a typical american chain nothing amazing! The burger selection was large so that's a plus. I ordered the mushroom burger and it was ehh...after 2 mins the bun was mush and eating was just a hassle and messy! The endless fries are really ridic ..the fries come in a bottomless holder thing so corny! lol ahahaha But I just thought it was unnecessary and it took too much space on the plate. The service was mediocre..the waitress Angela only paid attention to twice one to get our order and to get our plates when we were done...she didn't come by to refill our drinks or ask how everything was. It wasn't even busy! I was turned off.    I wouldn't come back, just go to shake shack! more worth your money !

You could have blind folded me and I would have thought I was in Friday's or Chili's when the blindfold was lifted.  Wasn't impressed.  We sat at the bar because that was all that was available.   Waited over a half hour for our lunch as we watched others who came in after us receive theirs.  I think the bartender might have overheard us joking about the slowness and apologized that they had to send someone home from the kitchen.  Not sure if they were sick or fired.  She did offer us a basket of fries on the house for our troubles.  Only problem is they never gave them to us.  Very weird. I can't front on the burger though.  It was good.  I had the Blue Ribbon Burger.  Crumbled Blue Cheese, zesty chipotle mayo and onion straws on the burger were a nice contrast.  I substituted cole slaw for fries.  Nothing special.  Unlimited refills on the Raspberry Limeade were refreshing. If you are into chains, you will dig this place.  I wasn't thrilled, but I'm not a chain guy.  Red Robin....yummmmmmm.  Had to do it.  2.5 to be fair.

I came here for a quick lunch. I only have an hour for work. I arrived at 115 to a fairly empty restaurant, I'm assuming the lunch rush had passed . We were seated right away and it took a few minutes to get our drink orders. We were ready to place our entree right away as we were in a hurry but the server took the drink order and left. Once we finally ordered it took about 40 minutes for the food to come out. Once it came out, it was ice cold. I mentioned to our server that the food was ice cold and we were in a hurry. She offered to have the order remade in 5 minutes and boxed up. She did just that and comped our meal. Great waitress who handled the situation perfectly. I was very impressed with her. I would come back again, just not when I'm in a hurry. Food is good. wish I could have enjoyed the bottomless fries and bottomless root beer float but next time

Okay, so, I have two desperate experiences that I want to discuss for this Red Robin. 1) First time, I went with 3 friends. I had a chicken burger and we ordered some appetizers, and those were actually pretty good. So as far as food is concerned, I can't complain tremendously about the first time. However, the service is where the major issues were. The service was moderately slow (not as bad as the second time, but I'll get back to that). The person who made the experience quite unfortunate was the waitress. She was quite poor and granted, my group can be a little loud, that's just how we are. But I guess our waitress took a disliking to us. She'd purposely avoid coming the table to ask us if there was anything we needed. A few times times we even made eye contact with her, it was obvious she saw us, but she went about her business.  The final straw was when my friend and I went to the bathroom. As we were coming back, we heard our waitress talking about us and describing some of the members of our group with inappropriate language. We were so upset that we didn't even leave a tip. I have the utmost respect for people who work in the food industry and like to leave no less than a 20% tip, but there was a clear crossing of the line. Also, my friend has a gluten intolerance disease and he needed his French fries prepared in a separate batch. The first batch seemed to settle in okay, but as soon as he wanted to take advantage of the bottomless fries, he started feeling sick, which led us to believe there was some cross contamination 2) Two of my friends and I decided we'd give Red Robin another chance, but this time turned out to be worse than the first. This time, the waitress we had was about the only good part of it. She was incredibly sweet and apologetic about the woefully slow service we had.  I would never recommend the clucks and shrimp dish. It was shameful how tiny and poor quality the portion was for the price they charged. It was disgraceful. I had to eat like three rounds of French fries because I was starving after having the 3 baby shrimp and 2 small chicken tenders.  During that experience, my friends think we discovered why their service is so abominable. They have their bottomless fries and drinks, but probably want to discourage people from sticking with the slow service. Also, many of the French fry refills were cold when we finally got them.  My friend, once again, got very sick from what we think was cross contamination. We were happy the manager came out and apologized, taking off his meal from the bill, but health means more than money. Because of the slow service and the way the food affected my friend, it's safe to say there will not be a third time.

There really isn't anything bad to say about this place. The wait was pretty long, but that's not really something that can be helped on a Saturday night. The service also didn't suffer because of it. Our server was really attentive and our food came out really quickly despite the fact that almost every table was occupied. I got the crispy chicken burger, which wasn't bad. It wasn't anything fancy, but I would highly recommend and return. My friend and I also didn't know bottomless steak fries actually comes with the meal, so it was an added bonus when we found out we didn't have to pay extra for them. The fries were definitely cooked to my liking. Usually when something like that is produced in massive amounts, it tends to be less than appealing, but they were yum.
