I would say this is the place to come if you're craving a burger and don't want to pay too much!
The wait is longer than average for sit-n-dine places. The LCD TV's are way too small. I had get up and walk over to the nearest TV to finish watching a sporting event.

When Red Robin opened 2 yrs ago I thought it was pretty good. However, since then I've experienced superior burger places throughout LI and NYC.  Each time we come back to this place the quality of food and service  just gets worst. The fries are bland tasteless thick fries. The seasoning on the table is more salt than any other spices and you have to be on the server's ass to get refills of fries. This place is so blah. Whats the point of going to Red Robin when you can get better burgers at Bob's Burger Palace, Smashburgers, and even Five Guys. You won't have to wait over an hour to be seated and get your food at these places. You don't even have to tip. Avoid this Red Robins.

UPDATED: Stopped by again 2 months later to give them another shot. My review stands; the service still needs a lot of work and many common mistakes are being made by the servers and cooks. I'm not sure any number of free entree courtesy coupons is worth the trouble. A+ Excellent concern portrayed by the managers, I will say, but ultimately if problems aren't ever corrected how many times can one say I'm sorry. Originally written near Opening Day Stopped by the new Red Robin today, we were in the area and they offered a free Dining test run for up to 4 people , so we decided to give it go. This free offer was meant to evaluate and train the staff who are courteous, albeit a little green, which is understandable, today being the first day, so bear this in mind when reading. I've been pretty exited a Red Robin was opening in our area because it's very difficult to find a place for good burgers. However there were some real problems with the food and service that left us a little annoyed despite the meal costing only a tip. Had we paid full price, I would have been pretty upset as would most anyone.  Our waitress who was clearly nervous and perhaps a little overwhelmed took our drink orders; 2 ice tea's and a shake, then she disappeared. 10 minutes later, another waitress, noticing our frustration came by and explained to me the first waitress went on break during our service, she must not have put the order in or told anyone our table was waiting.  So, we received our drinks, less the milkshake and she took our order for food. One entree, cod fish and chips and a blue cheese burger, pretty simple chain food fair. For some reason, the milkshake never arrived, we called the waitress back about 5 minutes later,  she seemed a little confused as to why the milkshake had not been brought to us, puzzling. She ran into the back and about 5 minutes later we were enjoyed a mint milk shake, it was pretty good.  20 minutes went by and our food finally came out. This is also when our disappointment and starving anger started to take hold. The burger, which was ordered "a little pink inside" their words not mine,  was well done and cold. The entree fried cod fish and chips, never made it to us, instead they served me a cod fish sandwich on a bun.  Both items were sent back and at this point 2 managers caught wind of this debockle and came over to interject. We explained all of the little nuances making this a wild dining experience and they acted quickly to resolve the situation, both were extremely courteous and empathetic.  About 5 minutes later the cod fish entree came out, and I must say it was pretty incredible. My guest and I were splitting the food to give everything shot and the burger was warm this time,still well done, not "a little pink inside" as requested and the bun was still a little frozen.  The manager came back and explained the buns were baked fresh in Texas, then shipped frozen and were supposed to be toasted before serving. Somehow this step was skipped and well, it was a pretty bad burger, didn't get through more than a large bite of it and at this point another send back would have made no redemption.  Overall it took about 1 hour 25 minutes to eat lunch, taking into account our indecisiveness because just about everything on the menu looked great, the disappearing waitress and botched orders.  The Table behind us has already been served appetizers and drinks for 5 and I noticed a table full of managers who sat after we did, were enjoying some really good looking food, ;-(   I'm am an experienced cook and make all sorts of gourmet burgers and sandwiches myself; from smoked pulled pork hoagies to braised shanks and more refined dishes, I have a pretty high expectation for dining out and don't often go for one of these D&B chat-ski food is fun type places and after this visit, I think I further reinforced that idea. Still, for a quick burger and fries and some inventive appetizers after a movie, it might be the way to go compared to other places in the area. I'll give them another shot sometime soon giving them more time to work out the kinks in customer service.

Let me start this off by saying I HAD to dine here (I detest chains bc they never cease to unimpress me) because of the gluten free menu available for a fellow trick-or-treater in the group (not my child). Now that I've gotten that squared away;  we were a group of 9, four adults and five kids. The place was fairly quiet when we arrived after TOT'ing yesterday so there was no reason the service should have been as slow as it was but I digress.  It started to really fill up as we were getting the check TWO hours later.  Now, for a burger chain, this one is pitiful.  I ordered the Bruschetta chicken burger and there was no Bruschetta on it.  The bread was chewy and not fresh.  The food was lukewarm, not hot.  My kids had a pizza and cheeseburgers.  Kids eat crap anyway so I'm just glad they were eating something other than their bag of candy at this point although feeling like a terrible parent for bringing them here... We ordered the tower of onion rings which took too long to arrive.  It was hot at least. The food took forever to come out. Asking for a round of water for the table of our waiter was met with an excuse and the need to remind him.  What the what?  I'm paying you!   We placed our order after waiting too long for him to take it.  My poor son even complained.  He's 9!   My husband ordered a burger and when asked twice by a friend how it was, kept evading the question. I looked at his burger-  it looked like a beef patty not a burger.  Something is wrong with that when this is considered a burger joint. I ordered coffee with my dessert that I never got.  The "endless bowl of fries" offer that they claim is really only as good as your server.  I was lucky to my second serving of fries as we were ready to ask for the check, that I had to share with my table because no one else was being asked if they wanted more fries. My friend next to me ordered a chicken wrap and I noticed mostly coleslaw as filler with slices of chicken in the middle.  Pathetic.  My chicken bruschetta was awful.  It was a chicken brick that was warm when it finally arrived. I took a few bites and left it. The waiter was non-existent except to pretend to be helpful as he whizzed by robotically asking "how's everything?  Good?" and then he was gone. Dessert was gross.  My slice of red velvet looked greasy and unappetizing.  One bite proved it tasted like their fridge needed a box of arm and hammer baking soda.   This location serves old dessert. My husband said his brownie bowl was no better. There was no flavor!   I took one for the team eating here.  The best was when, our non existent smiley waiter appeared after we paid the bill to ask us to participate in a survey about our experience! Are you kidding me?  Every time I turned around too look for you, I saw you laughing and chatting in the kitchen!   Please spare yourself and go to Anthony's a few doors down if you don't need a gluten free option on a moments notice.  Ugh.  I'm actually sad that this meal cost us 80.00 per couple when all was said and done.  We split the bill.   Bathrooms:  decently maintained but all the way over by the bar and when you are coming out of the ladies room with your children men are coming out of the men's room directly across giving you full view of their bathroom and stalls inside!!

I just cheated on Shake Shack and have no regrets... YIKES! I ordered the Bleu Ribbon burger added with mushrooms, my husband got the A1 Peppercorn Burger, and our friend ordered the Prime Chophouse. All were cooked the way we liked and enjoyed it. The fries were good, but the best part is that they're bottomless! For shakes, I ordered the Salted Caramel and my buddy ordered the Gingerbread shake. I liked my shake but his was better. I'm assuming it's seasonal so get it while it last. As far as service goes, our waiter couldn't be more courteous. The manager also took the time to check in on us and other customers, that was nice. My hubby became an instant fan of this place so we'll be visiting more often.
